She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan.  It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.  The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better.  More items to sell will result in better profit.  Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ramona hopes that her business will continue to be successful and she dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Marcela works hard to support her family.

She earns a living raising livestock in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Marcela is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy additional livestock to raise.

Marcela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams of saving money to expand her business and continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Ecole Jiwe Group

texts.fr: Le client Kwiraviwe est leader du collectif d’affaire des enseignants, âgé de 29 ans. Célibataire de son état, le client vient  franchement de l’université. Il est encore jeune dans la carrière.  Il est confortable avec son métier. Il l’exerce avec zèle et abnégation. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira  de créer une petite unité de production notamment une boutique de produits divers. Ainsi, il va acheter les articles comme sucre, savons, Fanta, souliers, lotions, huile végetable, pétroles,jus, allumettes, riz, sels, biscuits, stylos, cahiers, etc. Dans le futur, il souhaite renouveler son prêt auprès de Hekima pour acheter un nouvel équipement de sa maison (chaises, armoire, appareil Télévision, lecteur, appareil électroménagers, etc.).  Au finish, il remercie fortement Hekima d’avoir pensé aux enseignants.
texts.en:
The borrower, Kwiraviwe, is the leader of a teachers' business association.  He is 29 years old, single, and recently graduated from university.  He is just starting his career but feels comfortable with his job, which he does with enthusiasm and abnegation.  This new loan will help him to create a small production unit including a shop of various products. Thus, he will buy items like sugar, soap, Fanta, shoes, lotions, vegetable oil, oils, juices, matches, rice, salt, biscuits, pens, etc.

In the future, he would like to renew his loan with Hekima to buy new appliances for his house (chairs, cabinet, TV set, DVD player, appliances etc.)  In the end, he thanks Hekima very much for supporting teachers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, Fanta, shoes, lotions, vegetable oil, oils, juices, matches, rice, salt, biscuits, pens, notebooks, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Obreras Productivas Group

texts.es: Germán, quien es el único hombre que aparece en la fotografía, es socio del Banco Comunal Obreras Productivas, ubicado en Villarrica; los socios de este Banco Comunal en su generalidad son artesanos, pasteleros y venden ropa nueva y usada. Germán es artesano de cuerdas para macetero, comenzó con este trabajo como un hobby, ya que lo aprendió en el colegio, y hace unos 5 y 6 años lo tomó como un trabajo más. No ha tenido mayores problemas con su negocio, salvo el tiempo, falta de tiempo para poder cubrir todos los pedidos que recibe de su hermosa artesanía. El dinero que está solicitando lo ocupará para poder comprar materiales como alambres, sisal y adornos para los tirantes. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder participar junto a personas que tienen sus mismos intereses.
texts.en: Germán, who is the only man in the photograph, is a member of the Obreras Productivas communal bank, located in Villarrica. The members of this communal bank are in large part artisans, pastry chefs, and sellers of new and used clothing. Germán is an artisan who makes rope for maceteros (decorative ceramic pots). He started this work as a hobby, since he learned it in school, and five or six years ago he took it on as another job. He has not had big problems with his business, except for the lack of time to be able to cover all the orders he receives for his beautiful crafts. The money he is asking for will be used to buy materials like wire, sisal, and decorations for the cords. What he has liked most about being able to work with Fondo Esperanza the fact that he can participate alongside people who have his same interests.

loans.use: to buy materials like sisal, decorations, and wire.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence operates a cereal-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a variety of cereals to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support given since the previous loan helped her to boost her business and also provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cereals to sell

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new beverages to restock her food stall. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new beverages to restock her food stall

loans.name: Vicente Orlando

texts.es:
Vicente de 42 años, tiene 16 años de estar con su pareja, con la que ha procreado 4 hijos de 13, 11, 7 y 6 años de edad todos ellos estudian,  él solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta sexto grado y con su trabajo sostiene a los cinco miembros de su familia.

Vicente trabaja la tierra desde los 22 años de edad, antes de eso era empleado de seguridad privada en la ciudad, lo que le quitaba tiempo para estar con su familia; por lo que decidió retirarse y se dedicó a la agricultora trabajando 6 horas diarias, además realiza viajes en vehículo cuando tiene la oportunidad.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mochila riego de agroquímicos, con ello se evitara andar prestando para aplicar el producto que el cultivo necesita.

El objetivo de Vicente es tener sus propias herramientas de trabajo agrícola,  que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios y tener la oportunidad que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
Vicente, 42, has been with his spouse for 16 years; they have four children who are 13, 11, 7 and 6 years old and all are attending school.  He was only able to complete sixth grade and with his work supports the five members of his family.

Vicente has worked the land since the age of 22.  Before that he was a private security guard in the city which took time away from family which is why he decided to retire and work in agriculture 6 hours daily.  He also makes trips in his vehicle when he has the opportunity.

The loan will be used to buy a bag used to spread agricultural chemicals.  With this, he will avoid having to borrow it to apply the product the crop needs.  Vicente’s goals are to have his own agricultural work tools, that his children complete their schooling and have the opportunity he never had.

loans.use: to buy a bag to spread chemicals.

loans.name: Luz Andrea

texts.es: Luz es una mujer de 29 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos, que desea iniciar su propio negocio, debido a que le ha sido difícil encontrar oportunidades laborales y su familia está atravesando por una situación económica precaria. Ella desea montar una sala de belleza en un local que es propiedad de su abuela, así podrá poner en práctica los conocimientos y experiencia que obtuvo cuando realizó cursos de belleza en una escuela. La cliente es emprendedora, activa, pujante y perseverante. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para iniciar su idea de negocio, pues aunque ya tiene el local, le hace falta comprar las sillas de peluquería, espejos y herramientas de trabajo (tijeras, cepillos, secador, plancha para el cabello), así podrá comenzar a generar ingresos que son necesarios para aportar al sostenimiento de su familia. Luz sueña con fortalecer y acreditar su negocio para que en un futuro sea reconocido tanto en el sector como en la ciudad, pero es consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar arduamente, con empeño, dedicación y mucha disciplina; sólo así tendrá los resultados que espera y podrá generar mejores ingresos para dar a su familia mejor nivel de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luz, 29, is single with no children.  She wants to start her own business because finding employment has been difficult and her family is going through a precarious economic situation.

She wants to set up a beauty salon in a locale her grandmother owns so she can put into practice the knowledge and experience she gained when she took beauty courses in a school.  She’s an enterprising, active, driven, persevering person.  

She requests the loan as support to implement her business idea because  even though she already has the space, she still needs to buy barber chairs, mirrors and work tools (scissors, brushes, hair dryer and hair straightening iron) in order to start generating income needed for family support.

Luz dreams with strengthening and accrediting her business so that it will become well-known in future both in the sector and city-wide but she’s aware that in order to do so she must work hard with effort, dedication and much discipline.  Only thus will she get the expected results and be able to generate higher income to give her family higher standard of living and well-being.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo y por la buena atención que la Institución brinda; esta inversión le ayudara  a comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar la cosecha y los ingresos los utiliza para los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: José has chosen to opt for another loan because he needs more working capital and because of the good service the Institution provides.  This investment will help him buy agricultural supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide, etc.  His previous loan helped him increase crop yield and he uses the income earned to cover household expenses.  His economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Amada

texts.es: Doña Amada tiene 48 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Esteli, casada, madre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración de pizza y quesadillas, desde hace 3 años. Inicio esta actividad comercializando sus productos de manera ambulante, poco a poco adquirió clientela y logro establecer su propio negocio. Ella cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, quienes la apoyan con la entrega de los pedidos. Esta agradecida con Kiva y mi crédito ya que logro aumentar sus ventas, obtener mayores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. La expectativa que tiene de su negocio es prosperar en sus ventas y adquirir mayores ingresos para mantener un buen nivel de vida. Solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima como: harina, jamón, queso, salami, levadura, aceite entre otros. Su plan futuro es comprar activos fijos como mesas, sillas, manteles, cocinas, etc, para brindar un servicio completo y de calidad.
texts.en: Amanda is 48 years old and originally from the city of Esteli.  She is married and is the mother of four children.  She is a merchant who makes pizza and quesadillas and has done so for three years.  She started this business by selling her items on foot, gained customers little by little, and was able to start her own business.  Her husband and children help her deliver orders.  She is grateful to Kiva and the loan has already helped her increase her sales and income and satisfy her customers’ needs.  Her hopes for her business is to succeed in her sales and increase her income so that she can maintain a good quality of life.  She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, ham, cheese, salami, yeast, cooking oil, and other things.  Her plans for the future are to buy fixed items such as tables, chairs, table cloths, stoves, etc. so she can provide complete quality service.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Don Pedro, tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive en la aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. toda su vida la a dedicado a la agricultura de cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Hace 15 años decidió por cultivar una parcela de café. El café lo vende en grano en la misma zona. Para mejorar su finca ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar fertilizantes y va pagar jornalero que le ayude para limpieza de la finca. Con esta asistencia el espera obtener mejor cosecha. Su plan es ampliar la siembra e incrementar la producción para obtener mas ganancias y poder vivir mejor.
texts.en: 63 year old Don Pedro is married, has 6 children, and lives in the village of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. He has dedicated his whole life to farming corn and beans. 15 years ago he decided to plant coffee on some of his land. He sells the coffee beans in the same area. In order to improve his farm, he has requested a loan of $500 to buy fertilizers and to pay day laborers to help him to clear the land. With this assistance, he hopes to obtain a better harvest. His plan is to increase the planted area and to increase production to obtain better profits and to be able to live better.

loans.use: to clear and fertilizer land for growing coffee.

loans.name: Phos

texts.en:
Phos, a rural villager from Banteay Meanchey province's Presnet Preah district where rice farming is a popular business in the neighborhood, is 53 years old and has six children. Phos is a rice farmer. Having engaged in this business for 25 years, Phos is able to save up to five US dollars per day from her current business after deducting the expenses. 

This is the first-cycle loan for Phos with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her son and daughter, who are specializing in marketing and finance and banking. 

She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her children and also help them to obtain a higher education background, so that they end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for her son and daughter.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Ebert Nomeli

texts.es:
Ebert de 26 años de edad, es un joven agricultor que solo estudio hasta noveno grado, tiene 3 años de casado y ha procreado una hija ya de 2 años, su esposa es ama de casa.

Es agricultor desde los 18 años, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su padre además, tiene un pequeño negocio de lavado de autos en la ciudad. Para llegar, viaja todos los días en autobús aproximadamente 7 kilómetros trabajando 7 horas y luego regresa a su hogar a trabajar la tierra.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una vaca, con el fin de aprovechar el rastrojo o el residuo de cosecha de sus cultivos. Espera producir un poco de leche y vender derivados para mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.

Ebert tiene como meta producir leche de vaca, no solo para venderla, sino que también le gustaría vender queso de buena calidad, así darle a la familia la vida que él no pudo tener
texts.en:
Ebert, 26, is a young farmer who only completed ninth grade.  He’s been married three years and already has a two-year-old daughter; his wife’s a housewife.

He’s farmed since the age of 18 having learned everything he knows from his father.  He has a small car wash business in the city.  To reach it he travels by bus every day for about 7 kilometers.  He works 7 hours and then returns home to work in his fields.

The loan will be used to buy a cow to take advantage of the waste matter from his crops.  He hopes to produce a little milk and sell its derivatives to improve his family’s quality of life.

Ebert’s goal is to produce cow’s milk not only to sell but also because he’d like to sell good quality cheese thus giving his family the life he was unable to have.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora de 26 años de edad, es una joven ama de casa, tuvo la oportunidad de realizar sus estudios hasta educación media. Esta casada, de dicho matrimonio resultaron dos hijos de 8 y 6 años estudiando primero y segundo grado respectivamente. Su esposo se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a trabajar la tierra.

Tiene aproximadamente 5 años de trabajar vendiendo frutas y queso fresco en ciudad, para ello toma un bus en que viaja aproximadamente 20 minutos a la ciudad todos los días, en la casa, cría pollos de engorde para la venta, actividad que aprendió de su papá y es respaldada por su esposo.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar lamina y cemento para ampliar la galera donde tiene los pollos.  Los  materiales serán comprados en la ciudad. Con la ampliación de la galera engordara  mas pollos y  tendrá mas ingresos para su familia así cancelara su crédito y con las ganancias sostendra la granja.

Tiene como meta además de ampliar un poco mas la galera de los pollos, poder reparar el techo de su vivienda y poder vivir cómodamente con su familia mejorando la vida de todos.
texts.en:
Dora, 26, is a young housewife.  She was able to complete secondary school.  She’s married and she’s had two children who are 8 and 6 years old attending first and second grade respectively.  Her husband works raising cattle and working the land.

She’s been selling fruit and fresh cheese in the city for about five years.  To do so she takes about a 20-minute bus ride into the city every day.  At home, she raises chickens to fatten them up to sell, an activity she learned from her father and that her husband backs her up in.

She will use the loan to buy metal sheeting and cement to enlarge the coop she keeps the chickens in.  she will buy the materials in the city.  With the enlargement of the coop she will raise more chickens and earn higher income for her family and will repay the loan this way; she will use profits to support her farm.  Her goal in addition to enlarging the chicken coop a bit is to be able to repair the roof at home and to be able to live comfortably with her family improving all of their lives.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rafi Group

texts.en:
Noauv is the featured borrower of Rafi group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been related to each other.

Noauv is a 50-year-old married mother of four children; she has been working in Mouneh business for twenty years. She's an expert in her domain and is always looking forward to improve her production and diversify her products.

She has loyal customers and new ones, which she always seeks to increase. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy current season's products, such as fruits, herbs, and many other traditional foods, to conserve for the upcoming season. She is also going to buy special Mouneh needs such as glass jars and bottles to conserve jams, tomato pastes, distilled herbs, and flowers' water.

Noauv is the first lady at the right side of the picture; she is wearing a black top with white and tan circles.

As for the other group members: Adal is the first from the left, Racha is wearing the beige shirt, and Dalia is the lady with red stripes top.

loans.use: to buy current season's products, such as fruits and herbs, to conserve for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh, 37, is married and lives with his children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns money selling bread. Minh has operated a barber shop in the local community for the past fourteen years. Minh has successfully paid off a previous loan through CEP that enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. He is now applying for a new loan of 15,000,000 VND to buy a barber's chair, new hairdressing tools and hair care products.

Minh hopes that this new loan will help him win new customers. He also hopes that he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a barber's chair, new hairdressing tools and hair care products.

loans.name: Wagino

texts.en:
This is the story of Titin, daughter of Wagino:

I like English lessons very much, and I hope that I can master it. I can speak it fluently. My problem at school is about paying the school fee.  My parents are poor; it is something difficult for them to do, but they want me to still continue studying. Learning many new things at school is very interesting for me.

I joined the student study club. I think that learning together is better than alone. Everything runs well. We stay at an unpretentious house. I know that my parents are not rich and are poor, but I have a dream. My future is better than at present time. I’d like to have a good occupation and a good salary. I can reach them all only with a good education.To all of the kindhearted lenders, I hope that you are willing to help me and my parents. 

My home town is Cilacap. It’s a dry, hilly and dusty town. My father is a laborer. His salary is about Rp. 400,000 (Indonesian Rupiahs). The number of children in my family is two. Their ages are 24 and 15 years old (me). Only I still carry on studying. This loan can improve my life because with it, I can pay my school fee well. I can concentrate more on my lessons. 

I take computer technics and networking as my majority. I like this because I am taught computer and networking deeply; about the hardware, software and the technology advancement day by day. 

After graduation, I’d like to work in a company as a computer administrator/technician. So far so good, at this school. It’s fun because I have many new friends and new experiences. I feel that the impressing moment is when I’m in a classroom and receiving lessons from my teachers. I love studying.

loans.use: to pay for educational fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, 49, is married and has three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City where her husband works as a breakdown motorcycle mechanic.

For the past six years Kim has run a food stall where she sells coffee and soft drinks. She successfully repaid a previous loan through CEP that helped her improve her business. She is now applying for a new loan of 15,000,000 VND to buy a range of beverages to restock her stall. She hopes this will help her to win and satisfy new customers.

Kim hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her stall and improve sales. She is working to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Mugiyono

texts.en:
This is the story of Gilang, son of Mugiyono:

My favourite subject is computers and networking. My reason to choose this vocational study is I want to be a computer expert, especially a programmer. Formerly, it might have been hard for me to make adaptations with new friends and a new environment, but it has not happened for a long time. Now, I am one of them. We know and share each other. Besides that, the teachers are also friendly. 

I am a member of the student football team. I can divide my time between school and after-school activities well. I enjoy playing football with my team, but I do not forget to study every day. 

My problem at school is about paying the school fee. My parents are poor; it is something difficult for them to do, but they want me to still continue studying to the higher level of education. I beg Kiva lenders, may you help me to give funds for my school fee. My condition will be changed if I get a good occupation. The requirement of getting a good occupation, of course, is good education.

I live in Persit village, Jeruklegi sub-district, Cilacap Regency. We have a broken soil road along the village to the sub-district. It is a hilly area. The occupation of my father is a walker-seller. He walks door to door to sell his products every day. His salary is around Rp. 300,000 (Indonesian Rupiahs). I am the only child in the family. If I get the funds from Kiva, it will be used to pay my school fee. It also will lighten the financial burden in my family. 

At school I learn many lessons, for example, English, computer and networking (my vocational majority), chemistry, math, Indonesian language, and so on. I chose the computer and networking because I am interested in computers. Computers are an unseparated thing from the world and human life. Besides that, I want to be a computer programmer. 

So far, so good, at this school. It’s fun because I have many new friends and new experiences. We talk and share with each other.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Severo Victor

texts.es: El Sr. Severo tiene 59 años, el se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años aprendió el oficio de confección cuando salió del país a trabajar buscando un futuro mejor para el,  ya que el confecciona variedad de prendas de vestir, tiene su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona del Plan 3000 de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  Este préstamo es su  Primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Severo va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión,  El Sr. Severo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes. Ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, el  Sr. Severo es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Severo is 59 years old and has been making clothing for several years now. He learned the dressmaking trade when he left the country to work, seeking a better future. He sews a variety of articles of clothing and has his workshop in his own home, which is in the Plan 3000 area of the city of Santa Cruz. This is his first loan with the institution. Severo is going to use this loan to buy fabric at wholesale for making clothing.

His reason for requesting this loan is to increase his working capital. Severo is facing challenges in his business, such as increasing his income. He is going to utilize the profits to purchase materials for making good-quality articles of clothing, and this way have more customer orders.

As he has a great deal of demand at this time of year, Severo is a very hard-working person. He feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided, as this is his sole source of income.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothing.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor, 35, is married and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez. For the past four years she has helped provide for the needs of her two children from the small sum of 6,000 PHP she earns monthly from her farm.

Amor successfully repaid a previous loan through GDMPC that she used to purchase farm amendments. She is now applying for a new loan of 6,000 PHP to cover the cost of having her rice paddies plowed.

Amor is working hard to improve her family’s general living situation.

loans.use: to cover the cost of having her rice paddies plowed.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 40 years old and married, with four children.

Carolina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, chips, milk, and bread.

Carolina has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Carolina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, chips, milk, and bread.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is requesting a new loan to buy a hair steamer and hair dressing materials. With these items she will be equipped to provide her customers with good-quality services. Hien's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that with the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a hair steamer and hair dressing materials

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en:
Phuoc is requesting a new loan to buy a stock of good-quality rice and flour to produce food to sell from her food stall. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a stock of good-quality rice and flour for her food stall.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea is 31 years old and lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district.  She has two children, one of whom is a dependent and still in school. 

She and her husband are farmers who grow rice on six hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for ten years. 

This is a microloan for Thea with VisionFund, and now she is in her second cycle as a client. The first loan, which she completely repaid, helped her relieve her family's financial burden and improve its livelihood. 

Now she is leading her group to request a loan, Thea will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Enkhee

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhee, who is 53 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a driller at a mining company for four years. His wife began rendering taxi service to local people in 2010. 

Their son studies at a university for a geology degree, while their five-year-old daughter is still at home. 

Enkhee is requesting a loan of MNT 1,600,000 MNT to pay his son's tuition fee. The borrower thinks the best thing he can do for his children is to invest in their education.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition fee

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon, age 46, is a single mother of two married children. She is a farmer, and engaged in growing rice on her family-owned farmland in Siem Reap province. She learned this business from her parents and older siblings at an early age. It is the sole source of her income.

At the moment, she has applied for a loan of 250 US dollars to invest into her farming business. This investment will help her to buy fertilizer for her rice crops. Giving enough fertilizer to her crops will maintain them at a high production rate. 

She said her farm work is almost complete, and she’s just waiting for the upcoming harvest season, so she will have much time to do other business activities to supplement her income. 

She is very happy with the loan support, and she is confident of paying her loan on time. This will be her sixth loan cycle from HKL. 

The previous loans were favorable because it allowed her to develop her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice crops.

loans.name: Donesia

texts.en:
Donesia is 57 years old and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Donesia runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Donesia has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Donesia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vouch's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Vouch, 28, has three children in total. Two of them are still in school. 

Vouch and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for ten years to make a living. She and her husband are able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day from their current business. 

Vouch has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Vouch will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and also to increase the rice yield to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and married, with six children, three of whom are in school.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, milk, and coffee.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from pig-fattening and fishing.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, milk, and coffee.

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en:
Mab, 41, lives with her husband and three children in a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Out of her children, she has one child who is still in school. 

To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost ten years. The current business earns her family about KHR 20,000 per day. 

Mab has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia, for five loan cycles and she completely paid back the loans. With the loans from VisionFund Cambodia, she has managed to improve her livelihood. 

She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Mab is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana resides in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, along with her family. Her husband is a farmer, while she operates her piggery, raising piglets for sale. She has been doing this for six years to earn a living. 

Juliana borrowed a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed and piglets to raise. She plans to expand her piggery using the generated profit from her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Asih Group

texts.en:
Noted as one of the oldest groups that received venture capital loans from MUK, particularly for a pig program, this spurs enthusiasm and hard work of all members of the Tunas Mekar Asih group to improve the outcomes of these efforts and they want to be independent, in terms of venture capital.

Because the price of pork is quite high, this time the loans focus on buying superior piglets for fattening. Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy superior quality piglets. She sold her sow because the sow is old and she will use the money to buy nutritious feed. She hopes that at the end of six months of raising pigs, the ideal weight is reached, the price of pork remains high, and she gets a lot of profit. Ni Ketut plans to keep all income earned and will use it as working capital.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets.

loans.name: Mariana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mariana, tiene 44 años de vida y vive en casa propia, disfruta de tres hijos ya mayores de edad. Ella, posee una tienda  también una granja de pollos para obtener ingresos necesarios y mantener el hogar, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años, lo desempeña de lunes a domingo de 6:00am a 7:00pm, ya que el negocio lo tiene en su vivienda.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar la mercadería necesaria, tales como: azúcar, arroz, aceite, sal, entre otros productos de la canasta básica. Esta inversión le ayudara a invertir más en el negocio e incrementar sus inventarios.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio para mejorar su situación económica y tener una vida mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Mariana is 44 years old and lives in her own house, and she enjoys her three grown children. She owns a store and a chicken farm in order to obtain the come needed to support her home, work she has done for 20 years. She works Monday through Sunday, 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM, as she has the business in her home. 

The loan she seeks will enable her to buy the merchandise she needs, such as sugar, rice, oil, salt and other basic needs products.

This loan will help her invest more in her business and increase her inventory. Her dream is to strengthen the business in order to improve her economic situation and have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, salt, and other items.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 44 years old, and she has four children, two of whom in school.

Elsa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsa has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins.

Elsa has been raising pigs for five years now, and she has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain her efforts.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para invertir más en su actividad; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar una vaca para aumentar la producción de leche.
Comenta el Sr. Mario que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, ya que ha tenido mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Mario needs to ask for a new loan to invest more in his business. This investment will help him buy a cow to increase milk production. Mario comments that the economic conditions and family circumstances have improved since he has had greater income.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn, who is 20 years old, is married, with one daughter, residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Her daughter is still small. 

To support the family, Thorn and her husband have been farming rice to make a living. Together, they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from their farming.

Thorn’s group consists of three members who are all female.  They have been with VisionFund for three cycles. Thorn completely paid back her loans with VisionFund and successfully used the loans to better support her family. 

She and her group members are applying for a new loan. As the leader, Thorn will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more rice and increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 49 años de edad,  logro sacar  el grado de técnico electricista, está casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tienen tres hijos que ya se independizaron. Con él, viven sus padres que ya están de avanzada edad y tiene que ayudarles en sus necesidades básicas.

Cuando existe la oportunidad, José hace instalaciones eléctricas en viviendas, al no ser un trabajo muy demandado en ocasiones a tenido que desplazare hasta la capital, alrededor de 80 km. solo para realizar instalaciones eléctricas, por ello se ve en la necesidad de realizar conjuntamente actividades agrícolas que aprendió de su padre para  tener ingresos que provean el sustento diario de su familia. 

El préstamo sera utilizado, para compra herramientas de trabajo especiales para el oficio de las instalaciones eléctricas, pinzas, destornillador, tester y demás.  Será más competitivo en el mercado donde hay poca demanda y mucha oferta de mano de obra. Así tendrá mejores ingresos para él y su familia.

Su  sueño es establecer y administrar una ferretería, venta de material y accesorios eléctricos. Quiere darse a conocer en la zona con el trabajo que realiza, ir ahorrando y  en un futuro poder optar a financiamiento atreves de préstamos para realizar su sueño.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old, is a certified electrical technician, married, his wife is a housewife, and he has three grown children. His aging parents live with him and he has to help them with their basic needs.

When he has the opportunity, José installs the electrical in homes, as it is not work in high demand on occasion has has had to go all the way to the capital, about 80 kilometers, to do electrical installations. Therefore he sees the need to also work farming, which he learned from his father, in order to obtain income to meet his family's daily needs.

The loan will be used to buy special tools needed as an electrician such as pliers, screwdrivers, testing equipment, and other items. He will be more competitive in the market where there is little demand and many offers offers of manual labor. In this way he will have greater income for him and his family.

His dream is to establish and run a hardware store, selling materials and electrical accessories. He wants to be known in the area with the work that he does, he will continue saving and in the future be able to opt to finance through loans in order to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy tools, pliers, screwdrivers, testing equipment, etc.

loans.name: Gandul

texts.en:
Mr. Gandul, who is 26 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been running an internet cafe for five years. Before the internet cafe, he traded currencies, and from the trading he made a living. His wife is currently unemployed and pregnant. 

He is requesting a loan of MNT 4,500,000 to purchase more computer equipment, such as keyboards, "mice," and processors. This equipment will ensure the stable running of his internet cafe. 

The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his internet cafe

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a widow with two children who manages her own flower garden to make a living. For more than 10 years, she has been selling flowers in town. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional variety of flowers and purchase fertilizer such as manure. She wants to improve her farm in order to cater more customers to gain more profit for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of flowers and purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of breads and crackers needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities and varieties of breads and crackers needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilibeth hopes to be more successful in life and business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partner/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different breads and crackers needed in her business.

loans.name: Kolab

texts.en:
Kolab is a citizen from a rural area located in Kandal province’s Kean Svay district, where crop farming is the common business to make a living. She is married and a 59-year-old mother of eight children. To feed her household, she earns a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn up to $6 USD per day from the business. 

Kolab has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. The past loan, which she completely paid back, enabled her to better support her business. Now, she is asking for another loan VisionFund to pay for the tuition fee for four years of her son’s bachelor's degree majoring in management. This loan will enable her to send and keep her son in university. She hopes that her children will have good and bright futures from his academic studies, and make a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for four years of her son's bachelor's degree in management.

loans.name: Yoert

texts.en:
Yoert, 31, is married and resides in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Bovel district, Cambodia. For the last nine years, she has been farming rice on three hectares of farmland. Yoert is able to earn about 46,000 KHR (Cambodia Riel) per day from her current business. 

Yoert is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on land plowing. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her rice paddy so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora María Esmeralda, es una anciana soltera, que sola busca la manera de ganarse la vida, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa en su casa de habitación y en el vecindario. Con este crédito solicitado desea comprar pintura para pintar una parte de su casa, con el objetivo de darle más vida para que se vea bonito su hogar.
texts.en: María Esmeralda is an older woman, single, who alone seeks a way to earn a living selling cosmetics and clothing in the house where she lives and in her neighborhood. With this loan she wishes to buy paint to paint a part of her house, with the objective of giving it more life so that her home will appear pretty.

loans.use: to buy paint for her house.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 36 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Jaime, con quien tiene 2 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que alquiló desde hace 4 años.  Ya tiene 2 años de experiencia en la venta de alimentos, su trabajo comienza desde las primeras horas del día, en la madrugada visita al mercado central donde compra diversas verduras y papa a los comerciantes mayoristas para luego vender las mismas en la feria de alimentos que se desarrolla en la ciudad los días miércoles y domingos. Después de comprar los alimentos los acomoda y comienza a vender a los pobladores por kilos de esa manera obtiene una mayor ganancia, le va muy bien en su trabajo pues obtiene buenas ganancias que le ayuda a cubrir algunos gastos, pero como es una mujer trabajadora los demás días de la semana se dedica a trabajar como peón en diferentes cultivos de donde obtiene ganancias diarias. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Flor, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de papa y hortalizas por cantidad para su venta.
texts.en:
Flor is 36 years old. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, Jaime, with whom she has 2 children. She cares for then in the house she has rented for 4 years. She already has 2 years experience selling food. Her work starts in the early morning hours. At dawn she visits the central market, where she buys different vegetables and potatoes from the wholesale merchants to later sell in the food market that is held in the city on Wednesdays and  Sundays. After buying the food she arranges it and and starts to sell by the kilo to the townspeople, thus getting a better price. It is going very well for her at work because she makes good profits that helps her to cover her expenses. Since she is a hardworking woman the other days of the week she works as a laborer in different crops where she makes money daily. This is her second Kiva loan and she promises to make her payments on time. 

Flor will invest the S/.1500 soles in buying potatoes and vegetables in bulk to sell.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora  Gladys  de 58 años   de edad es soltera, tiene 04  hijos que dependen de ella vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, en sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10  años  a la venta de cosméticos, ropa interior y ropa para dama y caballeros.
Doña Gladys  también vende carne de cerdo los cría y luego los destaza, sus ventas son de forma ambulante en los barrios y colonias de Nacaome, es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia, ha tenido que luchar fuerte para salir adelante con sus hijos  y es un buen ejemplo de lucha y perseverancia para los demás.
Doña Gladys  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de crema, perfumes,  camisas, blusas, faldas y pantalones con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA, es su tercer préstamo que solicita.
Doña Gladys  su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Gladys is 58 years old, single, and has 4 children who depend on her. She lives in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has her own home and for 10 years she has sold cosmetics, underwear, and clothing for women and men.

Gladys also sells pork from pigs she raises and then sells. Her sales are from house to house in the neighborhoods and communities of Nacaome. she is a very hard-working woman, honest, with wishes of helping her family get ahead. She has had to fight hard in order to be successful, support her children, and be a good example of fight and perseverance for others.

Gladys is asking for a loan to buy creams, perfumes, shirts, blouses, skirts, and pants. With the support from this loan she will improve her business and better serve her customers. she is very content to continue working with PRISMA, as this is her third loan.

Gladys dreams of improving her business and home.  San Lorenzo, Honduras - August 2013.

loans.use: to buy cream, perfume, shirts, blouses, skirts and pants for her business.

loans.name: Yulisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Yulisa del Carmen mayor de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos menores de edad aun, habita en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país ella es propietaria de un negocio en el que vende leche de vaca, cuajadas, leche agria también  bisuterías, y juguetes en general, ella es una persona responsable, trabajadora, honesta, de buenos principios, y con muchos deseos de superación, la leche la vende en su casa y de manera ambulante a clientes fijos y eventuales, las bisutería y juguetes los vende en el parque central de este departamento por las noches, ella tiene 18 años de tener este negocio y actualmente solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo, ella inicio su negocio con capital propio y uno de sus sueños es poder tener una estabilidad económica en su familia.
texts.en: Yulisa del Carmen is married, mother of three dependent children, lives in Chinandega department in the western part of the country. She owns a business selling cow's milk, curds, sour cream as well as costume jewelry and toys of all kinds. She is a very responsible, hard-working, honest person of good principles with many wishes to succeed. She sells milk door to door to regular and occasional clients; the costume jewelry and toys she sells in the central park of the department during the evenings. She has been in business for 18 years and today seeks a loan in order to infuse capital into her business. She began her business with her own money and one of her dreams is to be able to have economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy toys, milk, costume jewelry and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an engine for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Omar Andrés

texts.es: Omar, a sus 28 años de edad, es padre de un hijo de 7 años y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Nació y creció en el campo, donde un tío le enseñó todas las labores agropecuarias. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes fincas y actualmente está empleado en una finca ganadera, desempeñando el cargo de mayordomo y encargado de todos los cuidados de la finca, incluyendo el ganado lechero y de levante. Allí tiene 3 vacas de su propiedad, pues su jefe le presta un pequeño lote para que sus animales pasten en él y, además, le brinda la posibilidad de tener ganado de levante. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito, pues éste será invertido en la compra de 6 terneras de levante, así podrá aumentar su capacidad de producción y recibir ingresos adicionales para continuar solventando las necesidades y gastos básicos de su hogar. Omar es un hombre pujante, luchador, activo y perseverante, siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan sacar adelante su familia, esta es su principal motivación para levantarse día a día a trabajar, además sueña con ser propietario de una parcela donde pueda tener a sus animales, en un futuro a mediano plazo y así dar a su hijo una mejor educación y disfrutar con su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Omar, who is 28 years old, is the father of a 7 year old and he lives in a common law marriage with his sweetheart. He was born and raised in the countryside, where his uncle taught him all of the agricultural trades. During his adult life he has worked on various farms and today he is employed by a cattle ranch where he performs the role of steward. He is in charge of all of the animals on the farm, including the milk cows and young calves. He has three cows of his own there because his boss loaned him a small field so that his animals can graze on it and, moreover, his boss offered him the possibility of owning calves to raise. This is the reason why he is seeking this loan. It will be invested in the purchase of 6 young calves for him to raise. This way he will be able to increase his production capacity and to receive additional earnings so that he can pay for the basic expenses and necessities of his home. Omar is a fighter and a vigorous, active and persevering young man. He is always searching for options that will allow him to get his family ahead. This is his primary motivation for getting up to work in the morning each and every day. He also dreams of being the owner of parcel of land where he can keep his animals in the medium term future and through this he will be able to provide his son with a better education and to enjoy a better quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy 6 calves to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and different ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Choern's Group

texts.en:
Choern is aged 50 years and married with one child. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, earning a living through farming rice, while her husband works as a worker to help earn income to support the family. Together, they can earn about 50,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

This is Choern’s microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she has been a member of VisionFund for three loan cycles. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Choern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Cheng's Group

texts.en:
Cheng is a villager from a rural area located in the Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district.  She is 35 years old and married, with four children, all still in school. 

She earns a living through farming rice, while her husband sells coconuts and works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about KHR 35,000 per day from their jobs and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for the future needs. 

This is the fifth loan for Cheng with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Cheng wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and also coconuts for resale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and coconuts to resell

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold is single and living in Guintomoyan, jimenez, Misamis Occidental. For three years, he offered a service-based business providing motor transportation in his community to earn a living. 

He borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to acquire licenses for transportation business. He is hopeful to have another unit of motorcycle to be used for business expansion.

loans.use: to acquire licenses for transportation business.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa de 38 años de edad,  esta casada y ha procreado 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica trabajar en la construcción. De joven solo estudio hasta sexto grado, en aquella época estaba el conflicto armado en el país y por temor a lo peligrosa que estaba la situación sus padres no quisieron que siguiera estudiando.

Desde los 15 años cultiva la tierra, oficio que aprendió de sus padres que todavía son agricultores. Todos los días camina aproximadamente 500 metros desde su casa para llegar al sitio donde cultiva, cuando el esposo no trabaja le ayuda con el cultivo al igual que sus hijos si no van a la escuela.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar dos vacas, siempre ha deseado tener ganado y con el préstamo se le presenta una gran oportunidad.

Rosa tiene la meta de que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, y se preparen para los retos que la vida les presentara mas adelante, ya que es es la mejor herencia que un padre, le puede dejar a un hijo. También quiere reparar la vivienda, las paredes y el techo están en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 38-years old, is married and had two children.  Her husband works in construction.  As a young girl, she only went to school until sixth grade.  There was an armed conflict in the country at that time, and out of fear of the dangerous situation, her parents did not want her to keep going to school.

Rosa has worked the land since she was 15-years old, a trade she learned from her parents, who are still farmers.  Rosa walks about 500 meters each day from her house to the area where she farms.  When her husband isn't working, he helps her with the farming, as do her children, when they don't go to school. 

The loan will be used to purchase two cows.  Rosa has always wanted to have livestock, and the loan is giving her a great opportunity. 

Rosa's goal is that her children finish their schooling and prepare themselves for the challenges life may present them with in the future.  That is the greatest legacy a parent can leave to a child.  Rosa also wants to repair her home; the walls and ceiling are in poor condition.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol, 39, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. He is widowed. His family’s income is from leasing a rice paddy of two hectares. From the current business, he can earn about KHR 4,200 per day and manages to save about KHR 2,000 per day for future needs.

Sol is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. With this loan, he hopes to extend his farmland to increase his business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbayar, 33 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2007. His wife sells diary products by renting a stall at the food market. 

The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and needs some repair. So he is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 MNT to purchase shingles, cements, wallpaper, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will make his house more comfortable and a warmer place where his family will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase shingles, cements, wallpaper, fiberglass and foam to renovate his house.

loans.name: Silvia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Silvia de los ángeles de 51 años de edad, casada con cinco hijos uno aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria del municipio  de Chinandega ubicado en el  occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio y el turismo,  es propietaria de dos tramos que están situados en uno de los mercados de este municipio  en los que ofrece productos como: Ropa, zapatos, camisetas, blusas entre otros. Ella inicia este negocio en busca de un medio de subsistencia, ella tiene ya varios años de tener este negocio, Silvia poco a poco ha logrado tener surtido sus negocio donde ha obtenido ingresos para asi colocar el otro tramo de venta de ropa,  uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y su negocio, es por ello que actualmente solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo el cual servirá como inversión en el que comprara más ropa con nuevos estilos y colores, que puedan agradar a la demanda y de esta manera tener mejores ingresos. Silvia agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Silvia de los Ángeles is 51 years old and married with five children, one of whom still lives at home. She is from the town of Chinandega, in the western region of the country where the main industries are business and trade. Silvia owns two stalls in one of the local markets where she offers products such as clothing, shoes, shirts, blouses, etc. She started this business several years ago as a way to support herself and has gradually expanded it until she was able to open a second location. One of Silvia’s dreams is to improve her living conditions and to grow her business; that is why she is applying for a loan to invest in clothing in new styles and colors, with the goal of stimulating demand and increasing her profits. Silvia is very grateful for the support offered by Kiva investors to low-income people.

loans.use: to invest in general merchandise such as pants, shoes, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.es:
La Joven  Laura Isabel de 21  años de edad vive con su esposo, tiene  01 hijo  que dependen de ella, vive en una  comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, en casa de un familiar y se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de venta de tortillas y también vende frutas y mangos verdes.
Laura sus clientes le prefieren por su amabilidad y buen servicio ya que atiende muy bien a sus clientes empieza su labor desde las seis de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, también vende mangos en el colegio cerca de su casa.
Doña Laura es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como leña, maíz, cal,  y frutas, espera con esta inversión  mejorar un poco sus ingresos, y tener la materia prima para esta época en donde se vende bastante la tortilla.
Doña Laura su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que donde ella vive es de un familiar.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013
texts.en:
Laura Isabel, 21, lives with her husband. They have one son to care for and they live in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. They live in a family member's house. For three years, she has worked by selling tortillas, green mangos, and fruits.

Laura's customers prefer her because of her kindness and good service since she attends to her customers well. She starts work at six in the morning and works until six at night. She also sells mangos at the school close to her house.

Laura is a hard-working woman with dreams of moving forward. She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials such as firewood, corn, lime, and fruits. She hopes this investment will improve her income and provide her with supplies for the season to sell more tortillas. Laura's dream is to have her own home since the one she lives in now is a family member's.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, lime, and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora  Martha de 43 años de edad es soltera, tiene  dos hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, vive en casa de un familiar y se dedica desde hace 25 años al negocio de venta de tortillas.
Doña Martha sus clientes le prefieren por su amabilidad y buen servicio ya que atiende a sus clientes desde las seis de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, es una mujer trabajadora y su deseo es sacar adelante a su familia y su negocio.
Doña Martha está solicitando el préstamo para la compra  leña, maíz, cal y mejorar un poco su taller,  con el apoyo del préstamo espera tener la suficiente materia prima para esta época en donde se vende bastante la tortilla, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma. 
Doña Martha su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que donde ella vive es de un familiar.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2013
texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old, single with two dependent children. She lives in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras in the house of a relative. For the past 25 years she has sold tortillas. Martha's clients prefer her because she is friendly and provides good service. She works from 6 am until 7 pm. She is a hard-working woman who wants to get her family and business ahead.

Martha is requesting this loan to buy wood, corn and lime. She also wants to improve her work area. With the help of the loan she hopes to have enough raw material for this season which is when she sells a lot. She is happy to continue working with Prisma. Martha's dream is to own her own house as she now lives in a relative's home


 San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2013

loans.use: to buy wood, corn and lime for her business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a farm where she grows crops for sale and for family consumption. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor source of light. 

She will use the KES 13,800 loan to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house. She hopes that in the future, she will venture into horticultural farming. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp for lighting her house.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco, con 46 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a laborar como empleado de oficios varios en fincas de diferentes veredas del corregimiento. Desde hace 10 años cuenta con experiencia en la cría y comercialización de cerdos y, debido a ello, desea iniciar su propio negocio para generar ingresos adicionales para su familia. Cuenta con la ventaja de que un amigo le prestará una marranera y por esto se anima a solicitar el crédito, que será invertido en la compra de lechones para cría y engorde y el concentrado para alimentarlos, de esta manera tendrá la posibilidad de engordar los cerdos para la temporada decembrina que se aproxima, pues es la mejor época para venderlos a un mejor precio, aumentando así, el margen de ganancia por cada venta. Francisco es un hombre pujante, activo, trabajador y se esmera por sacar adelante su familia; él sueña poder tener alrededor de 100 cerdos de engorde, para criarlos y tener una producción escalonada que le garantice la entrada constante de recursos, así tendrá la posibilidad de ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación para su hijo.
texts.en:
Francisco is 46 years old, married, and the father of a son. During his productive life he has worked as an employee in various roles on farms in different parts of the small town. For the past 10 years he has had experience in the breeding and selling of pigs, and due to that, he wishes to start his own business to generate additional income for his family. 

He has the advantage that a friend will lend him a pig pen, and for that reason he was inspired to request the loan, which will be invested in the purchase of pigs for breeding and fattening, and feed for them. In this way he will have the possibility of fattening the pigs for December which is getting closer; it is the best time to sell them at the best price, thereby increasing the profit margin for every sale. 

Francisco is a thriving, active, hard-working man, and he goes to a lot of effort to move his family forward. He dreams of being able to have around 100 pigs, in order to raise them and have a staggered production that guarantees him the constant entrance of resources. In that way he will have the possibility of offering a better quality of life for his family and a good education for his son.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding and fattening, and feed for them

loans.name: Santos Willian

texts.es:
Santos de 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su padre, es muy conocido en la zona y trabaja en una peluquería;  tiene de estar trabajando 4 años en el negoció de cortar cabello. El oficio lo aprendió con el dueño. En la actualidad todavía trabaja como peluquero, para mantener a su padre que debido a un derrame cerebral tiene paralizado la mitad del cuerpo desde hace tres años. Con el sueldo de su trabajo willian compra las medicinas de su padre con la esperanza de que algún día mejore.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar una motocicleta para poder desplazarse, desde su casa hasta el trabajo y comprar de las medicinas de su padre para tenerlas a tiempo, también le servirá para ir a su trabajo que queda a 2 km de su casa.

Espera poder ayudar a su padre en lo que necesite una vez saliendo de la deuda.
texts.en:
Santos is 26-years old.  He is single and lives with his father.  He is well-known where he lives and works at a hair salon.  He has been cutting hair for four years.  He learned the trade from the owner of the salon.  Santos currently works as a hairdresser to support his father, who, due to a brain hemorrhage, has been paralyzed on one side of his body for three years.  Santos uses the salary from his job to purchase medication for his father, with the hope that he will one day get better. 

Santos will use the loan to purchase a motorcycle so he can travel from his home to work, purchase his father's medications and have them on time.  It will also help him to get to work, which is about 2 km. from his house. 

Santos hopes to be able to help his father in whatever he may need once they are out of debt.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel de 30  años de edad vive con su esposo,  tiene   tres hijos que dependen de ella, vive en su casa ubicada en un  barrio de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras.
Doña María Isabel su negocio es la venta de comida y golosinas,  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de frijoles, harina, huevos, queso, arroz, café, tortillas, etc. materia prima que necesita para elaborar sus comida. También desea pintar el local y comprarse una estufa industrial, con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos ya que la demanda es muy buena en su negocio y desea mejorar el local para atender a más personas y así tener mejores ganancias. 
Doña María Isabel su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que alquila.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Septiembre del 2013
texts.en:
María Isabel is 30 years old, married with three dependent children. She lives in a house which is located in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.  María Isabel sells food and candies. She is requesting this loan to buy beans, flour, eggs, rice, coffee, tortillas, etc., raw material she needs to make her food. She also wants to paint her stand and buy an industrial stove.  With the help of the loan she wants to increase her revenues. The demand for her products is quite good and she wants to make her shop better so as to serve more people and generate more income. María Isabel's dream is to have her own house as she currently rents.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  September 2013

loans.use: to buy beans, flour, eggs, rice, coffee, tortillas, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a degree program and certification in Financial Management.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don Juan de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 19 años de edad el estudia en la universidad, don Juan se dedica a la venta de hamacas desde hace 2 años vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Juan está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  hamacas por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan is 59 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and 19-year-old son, a university student.  Juan has been making a living selling hammocks for two years.  He works as a street vendor in the various areas and markets near his home.  Juan is able to cover some household costs with his profits.  He is applying for a loan to buy hammocks in bulk so that he can continue with his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hammocks in bulk.

loans.name: Xesaclac Group

texts.es:
El Señór Sebastian es casado. Tiene 42 años de edad. Curso 4 años de educaciòn primaria. Tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando. Se dedica al comercio, especificamente a atender su tienda de articulos de consumo diario. Iniciò este negocio por iniciativa pripia y hasta la fecha lleva 12 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prèstamo que lo utilizarà para la compra de mercaderìa para surtir su tienda. Desea en el futuro tener un local grande y bien surtido. 

Los demàs integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Señor Sebastian is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom still live at home. He has four years of primary education and now has his own business, a store that sells basic, everyday products. Sebastian started this business on his own 12 years ago.

Sebastian has organized a group and is requesting a loan that he will use to buy merchandise to stock his store. In the future, he would like to have a large, well-stocked store.

The other members of the group are involved in trade and raising livestock.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is the age of 34, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She belongs to a small family. She has two children only. Her husband’s income is not good, but due to less family members she can easily manage the household expenses.
 
She is taking a loan for her husband’s painting shop; in fact, her husband provides the services of banner writing for advertisements or publishing politician’s messages. His writing is very attractive because he has been writing banners for many years and has a great practice doing banner writing. 
He uses pieces of cheap white cloth, paint, and brushes for banner writing. 

At his shop, only two colors are available for banner writing. Nowadays a theater director gave him a contract to draw the pictures of casted actors, but he does not have multicolored paint canes. Therefore, Mumtaz requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy multicolored canes of paint.
 
Mumtaz says thanks to kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy multicolored paints for writing banners to sell.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila, de 49 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus hijos a los que quiere mucho y cuida en la casa que adquirió hace algunos años. Proviene de una familia agrícola y ganadera,  todas estas lecciones de vida han hecho de ella una agricultora eficiente. Siembra papa, maíz y verduras, así mismo cría vacas y cultiva la alfalfa, años tras años gracias a esta actividad ella puede sostener a su familia y ser una protagonista en su manutención junto a su esposo que ahora también la apoya en estas actividades.  Ahora se centra en la siembra de espinaca y zanahoria como también espera la cosecha de papa y maíz. Todas estas actividades las realiza por el bien de sus 3 hijos que la motivan a seguir adelante. Su anhelo es darles lo mejor para que lleguen a superarse estudiando. Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Domitila, invertirá los S/.3500 en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra.
