texts.en: Domitila, who is 49- years old, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her children, who she loves very much and takes care of in the house she acquired a few years ago.  She comes from an agricultural and ranching family.  All of life's lessons have made her into an efficient farmer.  She plants potatoes, corn and vegetables in addition to raising cows and planting alfalfa.  Year after year, this business has allowed Domitila to support her family and have a leading role, together with her husband, in maintaining her family.  Her husband now helps her with the business.  Domitila is currently focusing on planting spinach and carrots as well as awaiting the potato and corn harvest.  She does all of this for the good of her three children, who are her motivation to keep moving forward.  She hopes to give them the best so they can improve their condition through their studies.  This is Domitila's third loan with KIVA.  She is happy, as she has the capital she needs to improve her business and thereby her quality of life.  Domitila will invest the S/.3500 (USD $1,275) in the purchase of organic compost for her next planting.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Mario David

texts.es: Don  Mario de 51 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y horada, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la agricultura cultivando maíz y maicillo, cuando pasa la cosecha trabaja de jornal en una finca que se encuentra cerca de su casa, comercializa sus  productos en las diferentes agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Mario solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles de plagas, etc.  con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mario is 51 years old and is very hard-working and honest.  He lives in his own house with his family.  For eight years Mario has made a living in agriculture, growing corn, sorghum.  When harvest comes he works in a farm near his house.  Mario sells his products in the different agencies that buy and sell basic grains.  Mario is able to cover some household costs with his profits.  He is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies, such as fertiliser, manure, seeds, anti-plague chemicals, and other items.  With this he hopes to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, manure, seeds, anti-plague chemicals, and other items.

loans.name: Carlos Daniel

texts.es: Carlos Daniel de 34 años de edad  casado con un hijo menor de edad originario de uno de los municipios de chinandega, zona donde predomina el comercio y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas importante del pais, Carlos es propietario de un taller de reparaciones de motocicletas el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación, al igual que vende piezas usadas y nuevas para motos de toda marca, velocidad y estilo, el aprendió hace 10 este oficio como mecánico fue así como inicio con su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos familiares, el realiza sus compras al contado, y sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales los créditos los recupera los 15 y 30 de cada mes, el actualmente solicita crédito nuevamente para invertir en materia prima como: variedades de piezas usadas, grasas, focos, entre otros, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar el local donde tiene su negocio y poder brindarle a su familia estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Carlos Daniel is 34 years old, married and has one young child. He is originally from Chinandega, an area predominated by business and home to one of the biggest mills in the country. Carlos is the owner of a motorcycle repair shop, which is located at his house. He also sells new and used parts for motorcycles of all brands, speeds and styles. He started to learn this trade 10 years ago and started out on his own to increase his family's revenues. He pays cash for his purchases. He sells on a cash basis and also on credit for regular customers. He collects on the 15th and 30th of each month. 

Carlos is requesting this loan in order to invest in raw materials such as a variety of used parts, lubricants, lights, etc. One of his dreams is to improve his shop and to offer his family financial stability.

loans.use: to buy working capital such as various parts, lubricants, spark plugs, etc.

loans.name: Santiago Armando

texts.es: Don Santiago de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 19, 12 y 8 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 13 años su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Santiago está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santiago is 51 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and three children, aged 19, 12, and 8 years old respectively.  They are all studying.  For 13 years Santiago has made a living in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  Santiago sells his products in the area surrounding his home. Santiago is able to cover some household costs with his profits.  He is applying for a loan in order to buy fertiliser, herbicides, seeds, anti-plague chemicals, and other items.  With this he hopes to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, herbicides, seeds, anti-plague chemicals, and other items.

loans.name: Buyandelger

texts.en:
Mr. Buyandelger, 29 years old, lives with his mother and son in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been selling and repairing mobile phones at a trade center by renting a stall since 2004. Now he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase fiberglass, felts, and hardwood floor to renovate his old Mongolian ger. 

It is necessary for him to to renovation his home because winter is coming close. After renovation, his mother and son will live in comfortable and warm place. Also, their usage of coal for heating will decrease, thus reducing the amount of air pollutants released.

loans.use: to purchase felts, fiberglass and hardwood floor to renovate his old Mongolian ger because winter is coming close.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is able to support the needs of her four children from earning though selling food stuff in their community. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients and pots. A portion of her profit will be used for business improvement.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and pots.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a 30-year-old, married man, and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 2000, Musa has been in the business of selling medicines, which is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs additional capital to purchase medicines from factories to re-sell. He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

His net income is not enough to meet the daily and monthly needs of his family. He has lots of expenses to pay, like electricity bills, gas and water bills, children's school fees, and food expenses. He is planning to further grow his business in the future so that he can increase his net income and savings. 

Musa is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase medicines to re-sell.

loans.name: Fedela

texts.en:
Fedela is 56 years old and a widow with three children; one of whom is in school. Fedela works very hard to provide for them.

Fedela runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, chips, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Fedela has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Fedela would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, chips, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Doña Luz tiene 40 años de edad y en su juventud pudo cursar la primaria completa a pesar de las pocas opciones escolares que en ese entonces había para poder estudiar. Con los años ella se casó y procreo 3 hijos los que dependen de ella y su esposo, el mayor tiene 16 años y está cursando el primer año del bachillerato, la segunda tiene 4 años y hasta el otro año cursara su primaria y la última que tiene 18 meses de nacida. Doña Luz es ama de casa y agricultora se dedica específicamente al cultivo de café aunque cultivan el maíz y frijoles en menor escala. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde muy niña ya que esta actividad igual que la tierra que trabaja fue heredada por sus padres quienes lucharon para darles una mejor vida. Ella apoya a su esposo en todos los aspectos y actividades que en el campo se realizan pero se involucra más hasta la corta ya que tiene que cuidar a sus dos hijas menores. Ella tiene la facilidad que la tierra está ubicada cerca de su casa de habitación por lo que puede desplazarse a ella con facilidad para llevar alimentación a su esposo y cooperar con lo que ella pueda realizar en el momento.

El sueño más grande de Doña Luz es que sus hijos logren estudiar hasta la universidad para que tengan un título con el que se puedan defender en el futuro, además hacer crecer su negocio y lo lograra dándole mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos generando ganancias y re invirtiendo en ellas. Por lo que hoy en día ella está solicitando a COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café y poder prepararlos para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Doña Luz is 40-years old.  In her youth, she was able to complete primary school in spite of the few schooling options available back then.  The years went by and she married and had three children, all of whom depend on her and her husband.  The oldest is 16-years old and is in her first year of high school.  The next is 4-years old and will start primary school next year.  The last is 18-months old.  Doña Luz is a housewife and a coffee-grower, but she also plants corn and beans on a small scale.  She has made her living in this area since since was a young girl, as this business as well as the land she works were inherited from her parents.  Her parents worked hard to give them a better life.  Doña Luz helps her husband in all aspects and activities related to the land, but is more involved until the cutting, as she has to take care of her two younger daughters.  The farmland is located near her home, so she can travel easily between the two to bring her husband his meals and help with whatever she can in the moment. 

Doña Luz's greatest dream is that her children are able to study at the university level so that they have a degree with which to hold their own in the future.  In addition, she hopes to grow her business.  She will be able to do so by giving better maintenance to her crop, earning a better profit and re-investing the profit in her business.   And that is why today she is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL.  She will use it to purchase agricultural supplies to help her coffee crop and prepare it for the next harvest.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to help and maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Julia Elvira

texts.es: Julia de 29 años es egresada de la carrera de enfermería, actualmente se desempeña como enfermera en una clínica. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera pues siempre le gusto apoyar a otras personas.  Tiene como interés seguir preparándose cada día, pues ella sabe bien que de esta manera tendrá mayores oportunidades laborales. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito la cual lo destinará para el pago del  curso de especialización de enfermería. El anhelo de Julia es de ser una profesional competente en su campo. Julia es casada con 01 hijo aún dependiente.   Ella agradece a Kiva y motiva a para seguir apoyando a otras personas como ella.
texts.en: Julia, who is 29-year old, is a graduate in the field of nursing.  She is currently working as a nurse in a clinic.  She decided to study nursing because she has always liked helping other people.  Her interest is in continuing to learn each day; she knows that this is the path toward greater work opportunities.  That is why she is requesting the loan, which she will use to pay for a course in specialized nursing.  Julia's wish is to be a competent professional in her field.  She is married with one dependent son.  Julia is grateful to Kiva and encourages them to keep helping other people such as herself.

loans.use: to pay for a specialized nursing course.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn works hard to support her family. Ginalyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ginalyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as eggs, noodles, milk, canned goods, spices, etc.

Ginalyn has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Ginalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as eggs, noodles, milk, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOLANGE est responsable du groupe SAPONE. Mariée, elle mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 01 va à l’école et elle a 02personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits d’enfants depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché du secteur10. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 20 douzaines d’habits pour enfants.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider ses enfants et sa famille. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en: Mrs. Solange is the leader of the Sapone group. She is a married mother of two. The oldest is 9 and the youngest is 1. One attends school, and she has two people for whom she is responsible. Mrs. Solange has been selling children’s clothing for 8 years. She stocks up at the sector 10 market. Her customers are men and women. She wants to buy 20 dozens of children’s outfits. Mrs. Solange wants to use her earnings to help her children and family. She strives to one day open a big store.

loans.use: to buy 20 dozens of children's outfits

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach is 30 years old and a loving mother of a small child. She is a hardworking woman, working on a small plot of farmland farming rice. Her family is living at subsistence level because she can’t produce more from this land size. Her husband shares his responsibility by working as a construction laborer. The family doesn’t own a motorcycle, so every day her husband goes to work on foot or by motor taxi service, and this causes a decrease of their income. 

Meach would like to help her husband in his business and buy him a motorcycle, but she doesn’t have enough money to make that possible. That’s why she has requested a loan in the amount of 600 US dollars to buy a used motorcycle. With this loan, her husband can go to work on time without paying transportation fees, and therefore, improve their income.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for her husband to commute to his workplace.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 19 years old and single.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, noodles, milk, etc.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Josephine aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Las Malalbuenas Group

texts.es: Alejandra, quien en la fotografía aparece al costado izquierdo con una parka negra larga y un pañuelo café, participa del Banco Comunal Las Malabuenas, en este Banco los principales rubros de las socias son librerías, venta de ropa usada y nueva, confección de cortinas, peluquería, hostales, venta de perfumes, confección de figuras de cerámica y greda.  Alejandra vende ropa, se instalo con un negocio después de mucho tiempo vendiendo ropa en bolsos, así que tomo la decisión de poder tener un negocio establecido. No ha tenido grandes problemas con su negocio. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará más mercadería, más ropa. Espera que con la venta le vaya muy bien, ya que ha tenido mucha venta. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es poder encontrar un grupo de personas muy divertidas en las cuales podrán apoyarse.
texts.en:
Alejandra, who appears in the photo on the left side wearing a large black parka and a brown handkerchief, participates in the "Las Malabuenas" communal bank. In this bank the members' main businesses are bookstores, sale of new and used clothing, making curtains, hairdressing, lodging houses, perfume sales, and making ceramic and clay figures. 

Alejandro sells clothing. She set herself up in business after a long time selling clothing from a shoulder bag, and she made the decision to have an established business. She has not had great problems with her business. 

With the money she is requesting she will buy more merchandise and more clothing. She expects her business to do well as she has had good sales. What she has liked the most about being able to work with Fondo Esperanza is being able to meet a group of very fun people where they will be able to help one another.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children, aged 8 years and 13 years. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a cereals shop where she sells cereals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the long distance when fetching water. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water pump and water connection pipes. She hopes that in the future, she will access clean water. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and water connection pipes.

loans.name: Gs Sita Group

texts.fr:
Mme SITA est responsable du groupe GS SITA. Mariée, elle mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 36ans et le moins âgé a 25ans. 05 va à l’école.
Mme fait la transformation (dolo) et vend de la soupe depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Kokologo. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 05kilos de viande pour la préparation de la soupe et 10seaux de mil germé pour la préparation du dolo (boisson local).
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand cabaret.
texts.en: Mrs. Sita is the leader of the GS Sita group. She is a married mother of six. The oldest is 36 and the youngest is 25. Five of them attend school. Mrs. Dita has been making the local beverage dolo and selling soup for 20 years. She stocks up in Kokologo. Her customers are men and women. She wants to buy 5 kgs of meat with which to make soup and 10 buckets of millet in order to make dolo. Mrs. Sita wants to use her earnings to help pay for her children’s education. She strives to one day open a big night club.

loans.use: to buy 5 kgs of meat with which to make soup and 10 buckets of millet in order to make dolo (a local beverage)

loans.name: Deysi Azucena

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 31 años de edad solo curso el sexto grado ya que cuando ella estudio no habían muchos centros educativos para lograr seguir con sus estudios, sin embargo sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad. Ella tiene 2 hijos la mayor tiene 11 años y está cursando el sexto grado, la hija menor tiene 9 años y está cursando el tercer año de la primaria con ella vive su suegra quien por decisión unánime con su esposo decidieron apoyarle dándole cabida en su hogar. El negocio al que se dedica es el cultivo de café ella sabe realizar todas las actividades relacionadas con las actividades en el campo. Queriendo contribuir a la economía de su hogar ella decidió emprender un nuevo proyecto el cual es una pequeña pulpería la cual está ubicada en su casa. Doña Deysi tiene la facilidad que su tierra productora está ubicada cerca de su casa de habitación, llegada la hora de corta o recolección del grano se involucran solo ellos dos siendo sus clientes los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a comprar el grano hasta la comunidad.

El mayor sueño de doña Deysi es graduar a sus dos hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro, y la mayor meta es que su negocio crezca y eso lo lograra con una mejor calidad en sus productos y comprar más tierras para cultivar. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el propósito de comprar insumos agrícolas dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos y con las ganancias re invertir en sus cultivos generando ganancias y apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Deysi is 31 years old and only studied through the 6th grade, due to the fact that there were few schools in her area where she could continue her education. However, her parents taught her how to work the land at a very young age. Deysi has two children; her elder daughter is 11 years old and in sixth grade, while her younger daughter is 9 and in her third year of primary school. Deysi and her husband decided together to help her mother-in-law by taking her into their home. Deysi’s business consists of growing coffee beans and she is very knowledgeable about the cultivation of this crop. In order to help support her family, she recently started a new project, a small grocery store that is located in her home. Doña Deysi’s fields are located close to her house, which is very convenient because at harvest time, she and her husband can work the land themselves. Her clients are buyers who come to her community to buy coffee beans.

Doña Deysi’s biggest dream is for her two children to graduate from school so that they can have a better future, and her biggest goal is to expand her business. She will achieve this goal by improving her product and buying more land to cultivate, which is why she is applying to COMIXMUL for a loan to purchase agricultural supplies and maintain her land. She will reinvest her earnings to generate more profit and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to maintain coffee crops.

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Mme DIOUMA est responsable du groupe. Mariée, elle mère de 09enfants. Le plus âgé a 45ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 02personnes en charge.
Mme vend du beurre de karité et du soumbala depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac de noix de karité pour la fabrication du beurre de karité et 01sac de noix de néré pour la fabrication du soumbala.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider à la scolarisation de son enfant. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en: Mrs. Diouma is the leader of the group. She is a married mother of nine. The eldest of her children is 45 and the youngest is 17. One attends school, and she has two people for whom she is responsible. Mrs. Diouma has been selling shea butter and soumbala (seeds or beans used in cooking) for 20 years. She stocks up in the surrounding markets. Her customers are men and women. She wants to buy a sack of shea nuts with which to make shea butter and one sack of African locust tree nuts with which to make soumbala. Mrs. Diouma wants to use her earnings to help pay for her child’s education. She strives to one day open a big shop.

loans.use: to buy a sack of shea nuts with which to make shea butter and one sack of African locust tree nuts with which to make soumbala

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois abritant ce groupe de seize femmes est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Elles habitent le même village et développent de bons liens de voisinage.


Madame Marème est âgée de 50 ans. C'est une femme mariée mère de quatre enfants (3 garçons et 1 fille). Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle capitalise une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite et a levé la main gauche.

Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 4 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d'huile de 20 litres et 2 tonnes de mil afin d'augmenter ses revenus.A part la boutique du village, elle est la seule à pratiquer cette activité, elle vend à domicile.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent d'entretenir sa petite famille et d'épargner à chaque réunion dans son Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois that supports this group of 16 women was created on December 14, 2008. They live in the same village and have developed good neighborhood ties. 

Mrs. Marème is 50 years old. She is a married mother of four (3 boys and 1 girl). She sells food products. She capitalizes on her extensive experience in having done this for more than 10 years. She is standing on the far right raising her left hand. 

She plans to use her loan to buy four sacks of rice,  two 20-liter containers of oil, and two tons of millet in order to increase her earnings. Other than the village shop, she is the only one who sells these items, and she sells them from home.

The earnings from her business allow her to support her small family and to save up at each meeting in her Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and millet to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a 42-year-old married man. He has two children. He operates a farm where he grows crops. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a water shortage. He will use the 95,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water pump for pumping water into his farm. His business goal is to increase production within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of 20,000 KES and 40,000 KES were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for pumping water into his farm.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lilia is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her mat-weaving business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her mat-weaving business.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad, alcanzo a realizar sus estudios de educación media, está casado y ha procreado un  hijo ya de 5 años que y asiste a la escuela. Su esposa, es ama de casa y se dedica de además de estar pendiente del hijo, también está pendiente de la mamá.

José, trabaja en una unidad de salud, es chofer de una ambulancia, ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en este trabajo. Para  llegar a su trabajo se desplaza alrededor de 3 km en bicicleta todos los días y su ronda de trabajo es de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde un mes y el siguiente es de 6 de la tarde a 8 de la mañana.

El préstamo será invertido en la reparación del vehículo, necesita un ajuste y es necesario mantenerlo en buen estado para evitar desperfectos mecánicos y así garantizar la seguridad de la familia.
José tiene como meta personal, instalar un taller de mecánica automotriz, desde niño la ha gustado trabajar en eso. También quiere que su hijo tenga un título profesional  y así goce de una vida que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
José, 35, completed his high school studies.  He's married and has had one child who's already 5 years old and attending school.  His wife is a homemaker and also takes care of their son and her mother.

José works in health as an ambulance driver.  He has five years of experience in this job.  To get to work he travels about three kilometers by bicycle every day.  His schedule is from 7 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon one month, and from 6 in the evening until 8 in the morning the next.

The loan will be invested in repairing José's vehicle.  It needs an adjustment and it's necessary to keep it in good condition to avoid mechanical failures and to guarantee his family's safety.

José's personal goal is to set up an auto repair shop.  He has enjoyed this work since he was a child.  He also wants his son to have a professional degree so he can enjoy a lifestyle that he didn't have.

loans.use: to repair the family vehicle

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Georgette est une femme de 32 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. elle possède et gère une mini boutique de vente d’œufs depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la ville. elle sollicite ce crédit pour lui permettre de renfoncer son stock de marchandises en achetant des œufs pour un coût total de 300000 soit 16 cartons afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et ses bénéfices. les bénéfices ainsi générés vont lui permettre d'augmenter son capital d'une part et de subvenir au besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, santé, logement) d'autre part.
texts.en:
Georgette is a 32-year-old single mother of two children both of whom attend school. For the past three years she has owned and operated a mini-shop selling eggs in one of the city's neighborhoods.

She is requesting this loan to bolster her stock of goods by buying eggs for a total cost of 300,000 XAF, equivalent to 16 cartons of eggs, to increase her turnover and profits.

The profits thus generated will enable her to increase her capital on the one hand and to meet her family's needs (education, nutrition, health, housing) on the other.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 33 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maribel is borrowing 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maribel has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: As a parent of five children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Marilyn is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks like chips, bread, canned goods, etc. for her general store business. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like chips, bread, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 26 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing 3,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs. Mary Jane has been fattening pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Wendlakogda Group

texts.fr:
Mme T.JULIENNE représente le groupe WENDLAKOGDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 07mois. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge. 
Mme vend du dolo (boisson local)  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Bissighin. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 20bidon de dolo (boisson local) pour revendre.  
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir  son champs d’activité  et  améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Julienne represents the Wendlakogda group. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 17 years old and youngest is seven months old. Three go to school. She has four persons to care for.

She has been selling dolo (a local drink) for the past three years. She gets her supplies from Bissighin. Her customers are both men and women. She wants to buy 20 containers of dolo for resale.

She would like to save her profits to strengthen her business. She aims to expand her field of activity and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy 20 cans of dolo (a local drink) for resale.

loans.name: Josué Otoniel

texts.es:
Josué de 23 años de edad, gracias a la oportunidad que le dieron sus padres, termino sus estudios de educación media. Actualmente  esta soltero, vive con sus padres, a quienes apoya económicamente gracias a los ingresos que genera con su trabajo.

Después de terminar sus estudios y como es una persona emprendedora, comenzó a trabajar distribuyendo medicinas, trabajando todos los días de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde, llegando a poco mas de un año de experiencia en el negocio.

El préstamo será utilizado en el negocio, al ser un distribuidor, él compra y revende medicamentos. por lo que comprara mas producto a sus proveedores y tener mas mercadería para vender a sus clientes.

El objetivo de Josué, es tener una tienda en su vivienda, una que venta artículos de primera necesidad y también una pequeña farmacia. También quiere instalar un local cerca del mercado para vender granos básicos.
texts.en:
Josué, 23, finished high school thanks to the opportunity his parents gave him.  Currently he's single and lives with his parents, whom he helps financially with the income he earns from his job.

He's an enterprising person, so after finishing his studies he started work distributing medicine.  He works every day from 7 in the morning until 5 at night and has a little more than a year of experience in the business.

The loan will be used in Josué's business.  He's a distributor, so he buys and sells medicine.  He's going to buy more products from his suppliers so he has more merchandise to sell to his customers.

Josué's goal is to have a store in his home where he sells necessities and has a small pharmacy.  He also wants to set up a place close to the market to sell staples.

loans.use: to buy medicine to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, three of whom are in school, Merlita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Merlita is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy stocks to resell like soap, milk, sugar, cream, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business. Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks to resell like soap, milk, sugar, cream, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 52 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Monica works very hard to provide for them. Monica runs a buy-and-sell recycled materials business in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional recycled materials to resell. Monica has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional recycled materials to resell.

loans.name: Ghulam

texts.en:
Mr. Ghulam is a 32-year-old man who lives with his family in Punjab, Pakistan. Since 2005, Mr. Ghulam has been running his own medical store near his house. He sells a variety of medicines in the store. He purchases a variety of medicines from the factories and resells them in the main market. 

He is currently in need of purchasing more medicines for his store, but due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of medicines to resell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and has one child.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, cream, coffee, eggs, noodles, etc.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Virginia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, cream, coffee, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 58 years old and married with four children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of charcoal and firewood business in the Philippines and requested a 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal and firewood business for 38 years and also earns an income from food vending and farming sugarcane.

Elsie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. Emma is widow and has a motorcycle-transport business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a 19,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Emma has been in this business for 16 years now.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Yeni Carolina

texts.es:
Yeni es una joven de 25 años de edad la cual curso hasta el sexto grado y tiene una hija que tiene 4 años quien nació prematura y por tal razón necesita de mayor cuidado. Con ella viven dos de sus hermanos uno de ellos ya casado pero sin hijos y otro que es soltero quienes trabajan como obreros en otras tierras. El negocio al que se dedica es el cultivo de café ella aprendió esta actividad desde niña y ahora lo desarrolla con su conyugue ya que es el su único apoyo. Sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia e hija son generados de esta actividad la cual ha sido medio de ingresos en su familia por años. El terreno que cultivan con su compañero de hogar es herencia de sus padres una parte y la otra de su conyugue los cuales están ubicados aproximadamente a una hora y media de distancia caminando y así se trasladan ya que no tienen los medios para comprar un automóvil, ellos hasta este año producirán ya que sus cultivos son nuevos.

El mayor sueño que tiene es arreglar la casa que le heredo su padre y en la cual viven ya que es de solo una pieza y quiere hacer las divisiones para que su hija tenga su propio cuarto, esto considera que lo lograra mejorando sus cultivos y sabiendo administrar su negocio. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a COMIXMUL con el cual comprara insumos como abono, foliares, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, insecticida para dar una mejor y mayor atención a sus cultivos de café.
texts.en: Yeni is a young 25-year-old woman who studied up to sixth grade and has a 4 year-old daughter who was born prematurely and therefore needs special care. She lives with her two brothers, one of whom is married but does not have children and the other is single. Both of them work in agriculture. She works growing coffee, a trade that she learned as a child and now carries out with her husband to support their family. Her income to support the family and her daughter come from this work which has been the sole source of income for the family for many years. The land that they grow on was given to them by her parents and part belongs to her husband. The land is located about an hour and a half by foot from their home, and this is how the get there as they cannot afford to buy a car. Her dream is to fix up the house that she inherited from her father, which is where they live, as it only has one room, and she wants to split it so that her daughter can have her own bedroom. She believes that she will be able to do this by improving her crops and learning how to run her business. She is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL to buy supplies such as manure, leaf fertilizer, fertilizer, coffee formula, and insecticide so that she can attend to her crops better.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help with the upkeep of her coffee crops.

loans.name: Ramongwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme BLANDINE représente le groupe RAMONGWENDE.  Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des légumes depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Toecin. Ses clients sont les femmes de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter  02paniers  de tomate, 01sac de choux e et 01sac d’aubergine.  
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son champs d’activité et améliorer sa condition  de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Blandine represents the Ramongwende group. She is doing well; she is married and is the mother of three children. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is six years old. Two of them go to school.

She has been selling vegetables for the past seven years. She gets her supplies from Toecin. Her customers are women from her neighborhood. She wants to buy two baskets of tomatoes, one bag of cabbages and one bag of eggplants.

She wants to save her profits to build up her business. She aims to expand her field of activity and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of tomatoes, 1 bag of cabbages and 1 bag of eggplants.

loans.name: Ishrat's Group

texts.en:
Ishrat belongs to a religious family; she is age 43 and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. In her family, the ladies are not allowed to do any outside work. Her husband is in business selling caps, gloves and goggles near schools and colleges beside the roads, signals and historical places of Lahore city. He places the inventory of various colors over a flat board for display to offer to his customers. 

Now, Ishrat requested a loan for her elder son who has been learning this technique from his father. Her son has become an expert and wants to start a separate business so that he can participate in generating income. Ishrat therefore requested a loan for her son to buy caps only. Her elder son has reached the age of marriage, and she wants to do some savings to arrange the marriage ceremony of her elder son.

Ishrat is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy caps for resale.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
This is Hermenia, age 56 and resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Cesario and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Hermenia oversees and takes ownership of the operations of their tricycle (motorcycle) transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. She also sells some snacks for additional income. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 PHP every day. To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and maintenance for their tricycle.

Hermenia hopes to have her own stall and dreams to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle (motorcycle).

loans.name: Alodoalome Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALODOALOME est composé de deux personnes qui habitent  le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Claire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Claire est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un boulanger du nom de Nestor. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Claire n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Claire vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges de ménage sont assumées par Claire et son mari. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Claire prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs accompagnés de sauces) qu'elle vend dans sa région depuis dix ans. A côté, Claire vend aussi des fruits. Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître leur chiffre d’affaires Claire ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALODOALOME, sollicite un deuxième crédit. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Alodoalome group consists of two persons who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to raise the level of their activity. Claire represents the group and is raising her hand in the picture.

Claire is 45 years old and is married to a baker named Nestor. The couple has four children, all attending school and under their care. Claire did not attend school. She lives with her ​​husband and children and assumes household expenses with her husband.

To meet the needs of her family over the past ten years, Claire has been preparing food (rice, corn dough accompanied by sauces) she sells in her area. In addition to this, Claire also sells fruit. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's markets.

In the quest for customer satisfaction and increasing revenues, Claire and the other member of the Alodoalome group are requesting a second loan. The previous loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: buy rice, corn, eggs and fruit

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Florentina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Florentina is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like coffee, softdrinks, rice, and other items to sell in her general store business.

Florentina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like coffee, soft drinks, rice, and other items to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to install fiber optic internet cables at her business. 

Josephine would like to apply for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy printer paper and toner cartridges for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy printer paper and toner cartridges for her business.

loans.name: Mubasher

texts.en:
Mubasher is a very hardworking and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Punjab, Pakistan with his family. He is a father of two children. His wife is a responsible housewife, and all of his children are students. Since 2002 he has been running a clothing shop, which is the only source of income for the family. He purchase variety of clothes from clothing factories and sells them in the main market at a profitable price. 

Currently he needs to purchase products for his shop, but finds it difficult due to a lack of finances. Mubasher has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase new variety of clothes to sell. 

Mubasher wishes to provide quality education for his children. He is very much thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 48 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them. Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, shampoo, noodles, etc. to resell. Emma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, shampoo, noodles, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school. Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to resell like canned goods, chips, soap, coffee, sugar, etc. Evangeline has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending. Evangeline aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to resell like canned goods, chips, soap, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en: Dorah is a widowed woman with two children who are adults. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. For the past year, she has operated rental houses. She faces major challenges like management and the renovation of her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the 30,000 KES, she wants to renovate her rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Sagar

texts.fr: Madame SAGAR  est une femme brave âgée  de 66ans et qui est toujours en activité. Elle évolue dans le commerce de tissus et a une expérience de plus de 20ans dans ce domaine. Elle sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000F pour renforcer son fond de commerce. SAGAR quitte son domicile à 6h du matin pour n’y revenir que le soir à 19h. Elle vend des tissus comme les basins, wax dans un marché de sa commune. Son mari est un retraité et c’est à SAGAR de gérer les charges familiales quotidiennes de la famille. A l’avenir SAGAR souhaite diversifier ses produits à fin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Sagar is a courageous 66-year-old woman who is still working.  She sells fabrics and has more than 20 years of experience in her field of work.  She is requesting this loan of 100,000 francs to boost her business.  She works from 6AM until 7PM.  She sells fabrics, bazin (hand-dyed, polished cotton) and wax cloth, at a market in her town.  Her husband is retired and it is Sagar's responsibility to manage the day-to-day expenses of the family.  In the future, Sagar would like to diversify her products in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr: La cliente Batasimwa est une président adjointe de l’association d’affaire « Nyota », doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 58 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des pagnes (habit) au marché public. Il y a 41 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle commença cette activité avec son fonds propre reçu de son époux. Grâce a ce commerce elle a réalisé plusieurs projets en faveur de sa famille et pour l’avancement de son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt lui servira à acheter 12 pièces de pagnes. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants avoir des diplômes universitaires et construire une belle maison. Au finish, elle salue l’initiative Hekima pour son soutien et autonomisation des femmes non bancables surtout dans le contexte actuel de la guerre à l’Est de la République Démocratique du Congo où l’économie n’est pas stable.
texts.en:
The client Batasimwa is an assistant president of the business association "Nyota." She is a dean, experienced entrepreneur, 58 years of age, and the mother of five children who are all studying. The client is a vendor of "pagnes," (a traditionally printed West African suit of clothing) in the public market. For the past 41 she has been running her business. She started this business with her own funds received from her husband.

Thanks to her trade, she has carried out several projects for her family and for the advancement of her company. This new loan will be used to buy twelve "pagnes". In addition, she wants to see her children have college degrees as well as build a beautiful home. She celebrates the initiative of Hekima for their support and empowerment of women unable to acquire traditional bank loans, especially in the current context of the war in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, where the economy is not stable.

loans.use: to purchase twelve "pagnes" (traditionally printed West African suit of clothing).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO est un groupe de l’association BINBAGALAWILI de KIBARU. Il regroupe 8 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, sont mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment et de légume à l’image de MARIAM qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KIBARU dans la  préfecture de SELINGUE (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
MARIAM, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KIBARU, et elle excelle dans la vente de légumes de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiment alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon, choux, aubergines) et des agrumes.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses articles à SELINGUE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group belonging to the Binbagalawili association of Kibaru. It includes eight women who became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties. On average they are 40 years old, married with five children.

They carry out various activities such as the purchase and sale of condiments and vegetables, like Mariam who is the first person sitting from left to right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in Kibaru in the Selingue district (part of the Sikasso region, Republic of Mali).

They have been running small businesses for several years and are very much in demand through their activities. To satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program.

Mariam, who is the group president and very well known in Kibaru, excels in selling vegetables used in condiments. She plans to use the loan to buy different kinds of food condiments (peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, eggplants) and citrus fruit. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako and retails her products in Selingue, for cash or credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to attain a monthly benefit of 15,000 CFA francs, enabling her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy various food products

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families. 

Bakari is unmarried, and has been farming for three years. He is currently growing watermelons, and is excited to expand into beekeeping as it is "an opportunity to earn from the natural vegetation" on his land. This is Bakari's first loan, and he plans to save up the proceeds from his beehives and eventually build himself a house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Julieth Danelia

texts.es: Una joven de escasos recursos económicos es Julieth quien a sus 21 años está por culminar la carrera de Ing. en Sistemas, que cursa por medio de una beca social que le fue dada por tener buenas calificaciones, trabaja como promotora de ventas para una empresa de pinturas para el hogar, con sus ingresos se apoya para sus gastos de transporte. Requiere el crédito para pagar el curso de titulación y un postgrado en Innovación y Estrategia de Negocios. Julieth tiene muchas ilusiones y expectativas en su formación profesional para buscar un empleo, en donde puede obtener un mejor salario que le permita apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
21-year-old Julieth has limited resources. She is about to finish her degree in Systems Engineering, which she is studying thanks to a social grant which she was awarded on account of her good results. She works as a sales promoter for a household paints company and with her income she is able to cover her travel expenses. 

Julieth needs the loan to pay for her degree course and a postgraduate course in Innovation and Business Strategy. She is looking forward to her professional training and has high expectations of finding a job where she can earn a better salary which will allow her to support her family.

loans.use: to pay for her degree course and a postgraduate course in Innovation and Business Strategy.

loans.name: Yalmar  Enrique

texts.es:
El joven Yalmar Enrique es un ingeniero agrononomo que vive en la Ciudad de Condega, a unos 35 km al norte de la Ciudad de esteli, este joven esta felismente casado y vive junto a su esposa y su hija que esta en edad infantil.
Este joven trabaja en una intitucion estatal y se desempeña como tecnico de campo en el area de capacitacion a mujeres productoras agropecuarias  en el municipio de condega, trabajando de lunes a viernes desde las 7 am a las 4 pm.
este joven se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel con el objetivo de hacer una formal solicitud para aplicar al proyecto de agua y saneamiento que Ceprodel y la alcaldia de Condega llevan en conjunto que consiste en la contruccion de servicios sanitarios con el objetico de mejorar la salubridad de los pobladores. el se muestra interesado en dicho proyecto y espera que el financieminto que solocita para este le sea aprobado y de esta manera darles una mejor condicion de salud a su familia, ya que el salario que este joven tiene no le es lo suficiento como para poder sumir el por cuenta propia los gasto.
texts.en:
Yalmar Enrique is an agronomist who lives in the city of Condega, some 35km north of the city of Esteli. This young man is happily married and lives with his wife and their little daughter. He works in a State institution as an agricultural technician in the field of training women in agricultural production in the municipality of Condega. He works from 7am to 4pm, Monday to Friday.

Yalmar Enrique visited the Ceprodel offices to make a formal request to apply for the water and drainage project which Ceprodel is carrying out jointly with the town hall. This consists of building sanitation facilities with the aim of improving the public health of the locals. Yalmar Enrique is interested in this project and hopes that the loan he is asking for will be approved so he can provide better conditions for his family. His salary is insufficient for him to cover the costs on his own.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr:
Née vers 1968 à FARABOUGOU, AMINA vit avec ses 8 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
AMINA na pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école,  très vite elle s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de friperie et du pagne bazin.  Après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents, AMINA est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 balles de friperie   et  10 pièces de bazin auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, à Ouelessebougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
AMINA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Amina, who was born around 1968 in Farabougou, lives with her eight children and husband in a nuclear family in the N'tentou district of the town of Ouelessebougou.

Amina did not have the opportunity to go to school and at an early age became interested in income-generating activities, notably the purchase and sale of second-hand clothing and damask "pagnes" (highly decorative pieces of fabric). Having repaid her previous loans in full, she is on her third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be used to buy two bundles of second-hand clothing and ten pieces of damask fabric from wholesalers. She sells her products for cash and on credit, on a retail basis, from home and in Ouelessebougou, to a customer base made up of men and women.

Amina hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000FCFA which will be used to help her husband to provide for the family's needs, repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Née vers 1980 à BAMAKO, AWA vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
Enseignante de profession, très vite AWA s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de l’encens et du savon. Après avoir correctement remboursé les prêts précédents, AWA est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante d encens  et 100 cartons de savons auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
AWA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Awa, who was born around 1980 in Bamako, lives with her two children and husband in a monogamous family in the N'tentou district of the town of Ouelessebougou.

Awa is a teacher by profession, but has also became rapidly interested in income-generating activities, notably the purchase and sale of incense and soap. Having repaid her previous loans in full, she is on her third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be used to buy a significant quantity of incense and 100 cartons of soaps from wholesalers. She sells her products for cash and on credit, on a retail basis, from home and in the market, to a customer base made up of men and women.

Awa hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000FCFA which will be used to help her husband to provide for the family's needs, repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Rengam Shg Group

texts.en:
Thangadam is a working woman and a mother of three children, pictured at the extreme left with her hand raised. 

She has a successful business with the previous loan that she got from WSDS. Her main activity is planting and selling local onions in a cycle of maximum three months time. With the loan she expects from Kiva, she wants to expand her business so that she can make more profit and help improve the family's ability to meet the challenges they came across from time to time. She wants to buy more seeds/saplings to plant and expand into other available areas of her land and to use organic fertilizer to increase the fertility of the soil to give more productivity and healthy products.

Thangadam and her other members of Rengam group mainly depend on the agricultural business by planting local onions, ginger, bananas and other items. They find it to be very profitable and make fast cash. Most of the vegetables they plant are used daily in almost every household and can be converted to cash within one to three months easily. 

They go to the main Bazar every morning about 35 km away from their place of residence to sell their vegetables. Thangadam is excited to make more income by availing the loan from Kiva and also says she will repay the loan on time. She also requests that Kiva and WSDS continue supporting underprivileged women.

The other group members are also engaged in growing and selling local onions.

loans.use: To purchase saplings and seeds of local onions, plant them and sell them for profit.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives outside of Magodi, in Kwale County, which is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Grace is married and has six children. She has been farming for 36 years, and she is currently growing cashew nuts on her land. She is excited to start beekeeping because it will give her a source of quality honey with which to feed her family. 

This is Grace’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to pay for her children’s education. Her hope for the future is to save enough money to make large improvements to her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in a small community outside of Kwale town, which is in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Esther is married and has four children. Both she and her husband work as farmers, and they are currently growing mangoes. Esther is excited to start beekeeping because it will be a good source of income for her family. 

This is Esther's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to save money for a dairy goat. Esther's hope for the future is to expand her number of beehives to 20.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.ru: Нурбубу 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей, все дети работают и проживают в России. У Нурбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нурбубу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав еще в 1981 году, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 жеребца, 4 теленка, 13 овец, а также имеет 2,10 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нурбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на свадебное мероприятие сына.
texts.en: Nurbubu is 52 years old, she is married and has raised three children with her husband. All of her children are now living and working in Russia. Nurbubu has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family she does animal husbandry and field crop cultivation, which she started in 1981 with the purchase of livestock for 2,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Nurbubu now has two milk cows, two stallions, four calves, thirteen sheep and also 2.10 hectares of land where she annually grows beans and clover. Her monthly income is 12,000 som. With the goal to further grow her business Nurbubu has come to the Microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy a milk cow and to increase the headcount of livestock. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of her livestock and also save money to have a wedding for her son.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Susy

texts.en:
Susy lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Susy is married, and has five children, the youngest of whom joined her in attending the Kiva loan meeting and is pictured above. Her husband works as a teacher, while Susy engages in projects on their land. She has been farming for sixteen years, and is currently growing bananas, maize, cassava, potatoes, passion fruit, and grass for fodder on land. Susy is excited to start beekeeping because it brings extra income at a low labour cost. 

This is Susy’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas se formo en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está en el 2do ciclo, es un grupo muy emprendedor y que fueron creciendo poco a poco y así son todas las señoras por medio de su trabajo van mejorando sus vidas.
Una de ellas es Carmen, quien arduamente trabaja en la despensa que tiene, comenta que empezó con mucho miedo, pero después poco a poco fue mejorando y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa, con productos como verduras, lácteos, carne, panificados, y demás, con lo que quiere seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas [United Women] was formed in the city of San Lorenzo and is in its second cycle. It is an enterprising group. Its members grew little by little and are all women who improved their lives through their work.

One of them is Carmen, who works hard in her grocery store. She says that she was scared when she started, but she improved after some time and has now a good customer base. She is a hardworking and persistent person.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her store, such as vegetables, dairy products, meat and bakery products, in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, dairy products, meat and bakery products, among other things.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak on the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

James is married, and has six children. James’ wife works as a teacher, while he himself has retired from teaching. He still works on projects on his farm, and is currently growing food crops like maize, bananas, vegetables and tomatoes as well as raising poultry and keeping dairy cattle. When asked why he wanted to become a beekeeper, James said “I am next to the forest and I will be able to tap into the forest resources through bee-keeping. [I] am also a member of the community forest association and I aim at using the forest responsibly.” 

This is James’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to sustain the life of himself, and his family. When asked about his hopes for the future, James said he wanted “to live a good life even though I am a retired teacher.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential bee-keeping region. 

Albert is married, and has nine children. His wife works as a house-wife and a farmer, and Albert also farms their land. He has been farming for twenty-five years, and is currently growing maize, bananas and beans on his land. Albert has already been keeping bees in a few hives on his land, and is looking forward to expanding his number of hives as bee-keeping has proven to be a good income source. 

This is Albert’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to save up enough money to buy a dairy cow. In the future, Albert’s hope is “to successfully educate my children.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.en:
Freddy lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been bee-keeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Freddy is married, and has nine children. Both he and his wife are farmers, and are currently growing maize, sugarcane, beans and local vegetables on their land. Freddy wants to start bee-keeping because “honey is good for our health and I want to be part of its production.”

This is Freddy’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children, and maybe even buy a commercial plot for development.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives on a small farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak on the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.
