William is married, and has ten children. Both he and his wife farm their land, and are currently growing maize, coffee, and vegetables. William likes bee-keeping because it will be an extra source of income from his land, and will diversity his revenue stream. 

William’s hope for the future is “to successfully educate my children as well as live a better fulfilling life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah lives on a small farm close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Fridah is single, and has been farming for three years. She is currently growing coffee, maize, beans, bananas and vegetables on her land, and also keeps some land as pasture. She likes beekeeping because it is not labour intensive: one only needs enough trees and plants on your land. 

This is Fridah’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to “further my education.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Elizabeth is married, and has seven children and several grandchildren. Both she and her husband have been farming for forty years, and they are currently growing maize, beans, potatoes, cassava and bananas on their land. She likes beekeeping because it is “not involving work” that allows her to focus on her farming. 

This is Elizabeth’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to act as an insurance policy for her old age. When asked about her hopes for the future, Elizabeth said she hopes “to see my grandchildren succeed in life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Ben is married, and has nine children and many grandchildren. Both he and his wife work as teachers, as well as working on projects on their land. He has been farming for twenty-four years, and is currently growing coffee, maize, bananas and tending to an orchard on their land. 

This is Ben’s first loan with Honey Care; he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his grandchildren and increase his personal income.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard lives and works outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Leonard is married, and has five children. He works as a farm manager on a commercial farm called Sogomo Estate, while his wife works on projects at the farm, currently growing coffee, bananas, vegetables, beans and maize. When asked why he wanted to become a beekeeper, Leonard said “it is easy to keep bees since low labour is required. It also enhances pollination… I would love to see yields increase so that we are able to cover our overhead costs.”

This is Leonard’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children. When asked about his hopes for the future, Leonard said he hopes “to live a fulfilling life as well buy a small farm for my family. I was chased away from my farm during the [electoral] violence of 2007/2008 and Sogomo Estate has given me a new life line since.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus lives on a farm outside of Kimilili, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak on the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Titus is married, and has one child. Both he and his wife work as farmers, and are currently growing avocadoes, maize and beans on their land, as well as tending to a blue gum tree plantation. Titus is excited to become a beekeeper because “honey is good for our health and [I] am proud to be part of its production.”

This is Titus’ first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to start a small business.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda lives on a farm outside of Kimilili, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Rhoda has six children, and many grandchildren. She has been farming for fifty years, and is currently growing coffee, maize, banana, sweet potatoes and sunflowers on her land, and also has a pond in which she does commercial fish farming. Rhoda had already kept hives, and wanted to expand her apiary because beekeeping “is an income-generating project. Honey is good food for us since it is medicinal.”

This is Rhoda’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives for her own upkeep, as well as educating her children and helping out with orphans and vulnerable children in her community. Rhoda’s hope for the future is “to expand my beekeeping project to commercial levels other than doing it on a [subsistence level]. I have some beehives and want to upgrade them and improve my beekeeping.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Symon

texts.en:
Symon lives and works around Kitale county. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak on the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Symon is single, and has been farming for seven years. He is currently growing coffee, maize, beans and bananas on his land, as well as keeping grass for cattle fodder. Symon is excited to become a beekeeper because “it is an additional source of income for me. Bees will pollinate my coffee and I am sure this will increase my yields.” 

This is Symon’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to “expand my coffee plantation as well as increase beehives on my farm for the purposes of pollinating my coffee.” Lastly, Symon is very happy about Honey Care’s partnership with Kiva: “I desperately wanted beehives but could not afford them since planting coffee on 20 acres of my farm has left me with no cash and this opportunity is God-sent I must say.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives on a farm outside of Kimilili, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Mary is married, and has nine children, as well as many grandchildren. Her husband works as a teacher, while Mary engages in projects on their land. She has been farming for twenty-four years, and is currently growing maize, coffee and bananas. Mary was excited to become a beekeeper because “it is an income-generating activity. The honey will be used for home use to improve our health.”

This is Mary’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives “for household use as well as for bringing up my grandchildren and also to help the needy in my area.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Wanjala

texts.en:
Wanjala lives on a farm outside of Kimilili, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Wanjala is married, and has eleven children and many grandchildren. He has been farming for sixty-three years, and he and his wife are currently growing maize, beans and sugarcane on their land. 

This is Wanjala’s first loan with Honey Care, and he is happy to have started beekeeping, as ”it will assist me to maintain my life as am growing older. I am now 85 years old, and though am strong, I need a steady source of income that will not require me to strain.” When asked about his hopes for the future, Wanjala said “I want to end my life’s journey in peace.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud lives and works close to Kimilili, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Eliud is married, and has thirteen children and many grandchildren. He and his wife have been farming for forty years, and are currently growing maize, coffee and bananas on their land, as well as tending to plantations of indigenous trees. Eliud wanted to become a beekeeper because “bees provide honey which is medicinal as well as an income.”

This is Eliud’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help “educate and provide my children and grandchildren with basic necessities.” When asked about his hopes for the future, Eliud wished that “I will have good source of income in my old age.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives and works close to Kimilili, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak on the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Richard is married, and has eight children. He and his wife have been farming for thirty-eight years, and are currently growing maize, exotic and indigenous trees, millet, bananas and coffee. Richard is already an experienced beekeeper, and wanted to add onto his current number of 32 hives (some of which are pictured above) because, as he says, “honey is wealth.”

This is Richard’s first loan with Honey Care, and he is planning to use the proceeds from his beehives to help educate his children. When asked about his goals for the future, Richard said “I am creating a pension fund for myself since I want to live a better life after retirement from my duties as a pastor.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives and works outside of Kilimili, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Rose is married, and has eleven children. Her husband works as a meteorologist, while Rose engages in projects on their land. She has been farming for thirty years, and is currently growing sorghum, millet, sweet potatoes, bananas, and maize, as well as tending to a plantation of indigenous and exotic trees and keeping dairy cattle. Rose is excited to start beekeeping because “its income will enable me to have capital for other activities on the farm.”

This is Rose’s first loan with Honey Care, and she hopes to use the income generated by her beehives to help educate her children. When asked about her dreams for the future, Rose replied “I love farming and dairy farming and hope to perfect it in the future.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives and works in the Kimilili region, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Moses is married, and has seven children. His wife works as a business lady, while Moses engages in projects on their land. Moses has been farming for sixteen years, and is currently tending to an orange orchard, as well as growing bananas, millet and trees in a plantation. Moses likes beekeeping for two main reasons: “It has a good income. The honey is [also] good for our health.”

This is Moses’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to “educate my children and improve my farming activities, especially dairy and poultry farming.” Moses’ hope for the future is “to develop a commercial plot in our township to ensure my family and I have a solid future.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa  está en su ciclo número 6º  del programa de comités, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder mejorar sus vidas.
Elva es parte de este grupo, y ella se dedica a la venta de prendas en general, ella también está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación para poder ir mejorando. Su meta es poder seguir mejorando sus ingresos y ayudar así a su familia. Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas en general, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por mejor su vida y la de su familia y también ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Guapa" is in its sixth loan cycle at the institution.  The members all work and help each other; and they are taking the poverty elimination survey to improve their lives.

Elva is a member of the group and she earns a living selling clothing.  She is also taking the poverty elimination survey so she can improve her situation.  Her goal is to improve her income and help her family.   The loan she is requesting is to buy clothing in general so she can continue striving to improve her lifestyle and that of her family.  She wants to start earning more money.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Roque is a single entrepreneur from Rizal, Jimenez in Misamis Occidental. He runs a general store to earn a living. 

Thinking that he wants to offer more goods to his customers, he borrowed 7,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional grocery items to sell. This amount will help him to sustain his business through his own efforts.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa esta en el 2do ciclo, son un grupo muy emprendedor y que fueron creciendo con el trabajo que cada una viene haciendo. Todas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren salir adelante e  ir mejorando sus vidas. Una de ellas es Andrea, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.
Ella cuenta que la vida esta muy dura, y que la única forma de poder salir adelante es trabajando, y es por ello que se está esforzando al máximo para poder salir adelante. Hoy pide de este crédito ya que necesita de una mayor cantidad de cosméticos para poder seguir con sus ventas. Ella y sus compañeras del grupo agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kuña Guapa" is in its second loan cycle.  It a very entrepreneurial group that has grown through the work of each of its members.  All of the women are heads of family who want to get ahead and improve their lives.  

One of the members is Andrea and she sells cosmetics.  She says life is very hard and the only way to get ahead is by working.  She is doing all she can to prosper.  The loan she is requesting is to buy more cosmetics so she can continue her sales work.  She and the other members of the group are grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice appreciates the previous Kiva loan that boosted her water business. In addition to the water business, she sells kerosene to passersby and her neighbors.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She thanks Yehu for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac lives and works on a farm close to Kimilili, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak on the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Isaac is married, and has twelve children. He has been farming for thirty-two years, and is currently growing potatoes, bananas, sugarcane and also has an orchard with passion fruit, avocado and mangoes. Isaac is excited to start beekeeping with Honey Care because “They are a bridge to self-sustenance in our area.”

This is Isaac’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to buy a dairy cow. Isaac’s hope and dream for the future is “to educate my children, to have better lives than I do.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo numero 24, son mujeres ejemplares, que están luchando por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde podrán saber en que aspectos de su vida necesitan mayor ayuda.
Nidia es una de estas integrantes, quien hizo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y mostró estar en un nivel bajo de ingresos. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de dulces, y de esa forma está luchando por ir mejorando sus ingresos y así también poder ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Nidia. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de dulces, como ser pastafrola, alfajores, caramelos, dulce de leche, dulce de guayaba, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is in its 24th loan cycle and all the members are exemplary in their struggle to get ahead.  They are participating in the poverty elimination survey which will help them determine what aspects of their lives require more help.

Nidia is a member of the group and, according to the poverty elimination survey, she has a low income level.  She earns a living selling pastries and she is striving to increase her income so she can help her family.

Nidia is requesting a loan to buy pastries such as "pastafrola", "alfajores", sweets, "dulce de leche", "dulce de guayaba", etc.  This will help stabilize her business plan which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: To buy pastries and sweets.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives on a farm outside of Kimilili, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak on the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Elizabeth is married, and has two children. Her husband works as a business man, while Elizabeth engages in projects on their land. She has been farming for ten years, and is currently growing maize, vegetables and bananas, as well as tending to a tree plantation. She is excited to start beekeeping because not only is it a good source of income, it will also provide her with honey for personal consumption. 

This is Elizabeth’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to educate her children. She is grateful to Kiva and Kiva lenders because “they have enabled us to get hives on credit to uplift our lives.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives and works on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

David is married, and has three children. His wife works in the home, while David farms their land. He has been farming for seven years, and is currently growing maize and vegetables as well as tending to livestock. David likes beekeeping because it is a low-labour activity that still provides good income, and is grateful to Kiva as it has allowed him to get hives on loan.

This is David’s first loan, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to supplement his children’s school fees. His hope for the future is “to ensure my children get the very best education.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and a widow with two children.

Josefina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, softdrinks, rice, etc. to sell.

Josefina has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Josefina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, softdrinks and rice to sell.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is still a single lady who is very hard-working and enterprising. Everlyne has operated a phone-selling business for the last eight years.She cites price fluctuations as her major challenge.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more phones and phone chargers for resale.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more phones and phone chargers for resale.

loans.name: Jazmin Poty Group

texts.es:
Jazmin poty es un grupo de la ciudad de Caacupe, tiene 14 integrantes, donde una de ellas es la Sra. Carmen, quien es la presidenta de este grupo.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, quien está luchando por salir adelante, ir creciendo y mejorando su vida por medio de su esfuerzo y dedicación. Vende prendas de todo tipo, y es con esto que da a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Hoy pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, como ser jeans, remeras, pantalones y demás, y así seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo, y también ir mejorando.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jazmin Poty", which is in the city of Caacupe, is comprised of 14 members.  The president of the group is Carmen, who is a person who works very hard to get ahead and to continue growing and improving in her life through her effort and dedication.  She sells all kinds of clothing so she can help her loved ones have everything she was unable to obtain.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as jeans, capris, pants and other items so she can continue working and improving her situation.

loans.use: To buy jeans, capris, pants and other items to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is aged 47; she is living with her four children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruits for many years; he sells seasonal fresh fruits in the nearby town. Due to his fruit’s freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. He uses a four-wheeled manual cart for selling, and as a hawker he can easily get close to the customers. The people like to buy fruits at on their doorstep instead of moving towards the fruit market. Due to his reputation the demand for fruits has increased and he sells all his fruits before the evening.

Nasreen feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. Nasreen is taking loan for her husband so that her husband will be able to buy fruits in more quantity to sell. He will buy bananas, grapes, papayas, plums etc. to offer to his honorable customers.  

Nasreen wants to save the excess profit amount.

loans.use: To buy fruits such as apples, bananas, peaches, papayas and plums for resale purposes.

loans.name: Potrero Zona B Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes de este grupo llamado potrero de zona b están ayudándose las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante. Están luchando por poder dar a sus hijos lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Una persona digna de destacar es Alcidia, quien además de ser miembro es la presidenta de este grupo. 
Ella se dedica a la cría, faena y venta de cerdos, es un trabajo muy difícil el que ella hace, pero está dispuesta a hacerlo para poder dar a su familia las mejores comodidades. Quiere que conforme pase el tiempo le vaya mejor en su trabajo, es por eso que sigue luchando.
Solicita de este crédito para comprar cerditos pequeños para la cría y faena de los mismos, y así seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The 13 members of the communal bank "Potrero de Zona B" are helping each other get ahead.  They are struggling to give their children everything they never had.  One of the outstanding members, Alcidia, is also the president of the group.  She raises and sells pigs, which is a difficult job to do.  But she is willing to do whatever it takes to give her family a comfortable lifestyle.  Over time she wants to improve her work and is striving toward that goal. 

She is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise and sell, allowing her to continue in her line of work.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and has two grown-up children. Only her eldest child and family lives with her. To make living, Teresita manages a mini-grocery store in their village. She is selling goods in their community. Aside from groceries, she also sells hog feed in the store. 

With her experience in selling, she has been able to improve her business in just span of two years. Teresita wants to expand her business further, selling various products like those found in the market; this way she can these goods them closer to her fellow men in their village. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy groceries, feeds and also rice to sell. 

She will do her best to make her business grow and ensure it is stable for the security of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries, feeds and also rice to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
This is Estrella. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional merchandise like women's wear, kid's wear and shirts to sell. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She also sells rice to get additional income.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional merchandise like women's wear, kid's wear and shirts to sell. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Estrella dreams of having her own stall. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like women's wear, kid's wear and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Lowena

texts.en:
Lowena is 49 years old and married with four children.

Lowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, coffee, soap, etc. to sell.

Lowena has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Lowena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, coffee and soap to sell.

loans.name: Toyunbu

texts.ru: Тоюнбу 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Тоюнбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Тоюнбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тоюнбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тоюнбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Тоюнбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Toyunbu is 43 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Toyunbu has a secondary education. As the primary source of income for her family, Toyunbu practices livestock breeding. She started this business 15 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Toyunbu's hard work, she currently has three milk cows and one horse on her farm. Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Toyunbu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy a calf to increase the size of her herd. Toyunbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also plans to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is married and has one child. She resides in Tangub City. Her husband is a seaman, while she is engaged in a business selling beauty products in their community. She collects payments in cash or installments. She borrowed a loan of 8000 PHP to improve her sales by buying motorcycle accessories and more beauty products to sell. She wants to improve her business and able to save her profit for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle accessories and more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 49 years old, married and has three children who are in school.

Ana Mae is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ana Mae requested a 29500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Mae has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and she has borrowed  from NWTF 24 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Ana Mae would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 55 years old, married and has ten children, two of whom are in school.

Francisca is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Francisca requested a 16000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer for her business.

Francisca has been farming vegetables for 3 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF 3 times in the past to sustain her business. 

In the future, Francisca would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her business

loans.name: Rakhiya

texts.ru: Рахие 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Рахии - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рахия занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рахии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахия обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рахия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en: Rakhiya is 35 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Rakhiya has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Rakhiya practices livestock breeding. She started this business 10 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Rakhiya's hard work, she currently has 4 milk cows and 1 calf on her farm. Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Rakhiya turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Rakhiya plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гулмиры - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулмира занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Gulmira is 47 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising four children. Gulmira has a university education. As the primary source of income for her family, Gulmira practices livestock breeding. She started this business 20 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulmira's hard work, she currently has three milk cows and 1 calf on her farm. Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for home repairs

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a widow and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She sells secondhand cloth and African print in Nakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 20 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cloth, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the types of products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cloth, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling smoked fish in Nakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. 

Esi is married and has three children; her husband is a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. 

In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the need of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of fish, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. Lolita earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 56-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past several years, has been running a business selling clothes. She buys clothing of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

She is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

Nasreen says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Orunbu

texts.ru: Орунбу 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Орунбу - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Орунбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Орунбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Орунбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Орунбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Orunbu is 36 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Orunbu has a university education. As the main source of income for her family, Orunbu practices livestock breeding. She started this business 15 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Orunbu's hard work, she currently has three milk cows and 1 horse on her farm. Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Orunbu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Orunbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es una persona muy sacrificada, que con gran entusiasmo trabaja para poder salir adelante, su meta es poder seguir trabajando en su despensa, y por medio de su negocio seguir dando a sus hijos lo que ella no pudo tener, a la vez de ayudar a su marido.
Este es su segundo crédito, y comenta que el anterior lo utilizo para poder comprar azúcar, fideos, panificados y demás productos, hoy solicita de un nuevo crédito para poder comprar harina, arroz, fideo, azúcar, etc. para poder surtir su despensa y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Elva is a very hardworking person, She works very enthusiastically to get ahead. Her goal is to continue working in her store and through her business keep giving her children what she wasn't able to have, as well as help her husband.

This is her second loan and she says that the previous one was used to be able to buy sugar, pasta, baked goods and other products. Today she is asking for a new loan to be able to buy flour, rice, sugar, etc. to be able to stock her store and keep working.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, pasta, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekua sells jean skirts and shirts in Nakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. As a single mother with three children, Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of jean skirts and shirts, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of jean skirts and shirts, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Miyansarpocho

texts.ru: Миянсарпочо со своими детьми живет на районе Дж.Руми. Пока ее муж работает в Российской Федерации она сидит дома и следит за детьми. Последние несколько лет ее муж работает заграницей и высылает им деньги на хозяйство. Ее дети немножко подросли, и у Миянсарпочо появилось свободное время. Она не привыкла попросту тратить время и решила открыть собственный бизнес по купле и продажи крупнорогатых скотов. Заниматься и развивать свой бизнес она будет у себя дома. Муянсарпочо сможет следить за детьми и заработать деньги для них одновременно. Деньги, которые ей муж высылает, хватает только на продукты питания, поэтому одна просит кредит. Все деньги она собирается потратить для закупа скота и корма для них. В будущем Муянсарпочо хочет собрать деньги на мероприятие по обрезанию сына.
texts.en: Miyansarpocho lives with her children in J.Rumy. While her husband is away working in Russia, she stays at home and takes care of the children. Her husband has worked abroad for the past few years, and sends them money. Her children have grown up a bit, and now Miyansarpocho has some free time. She is not used to wasting time, and has decided to start her own business buying and selling cattle. She is going to run the business out of her home. Miyansarpocho will be able to take care of the children and earn money at the same time. The money her husband sends to her is enough only for food, so she has asked for a loan. She plans on using the loan to buy cattle and feed. Miyansarpocho hopes to eventually save enough money for her son's circumcision.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, daughter-in-law and father-in-law in a small village of Telavi district, eastern Georgia. Her father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and produce wine to sell. They have run this business for 15 years. As the income is only seasonal, Mariam decided to start a bakery business and requested a loan of 1,000 GEL. 

The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and MFO Credo gives her a chance to get a loan and purchase all the raw materials for opening a bakery. After opening a bakery, she will bake Georgian bread to sell. This will increase the income, and Mariam will be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to open a bakery.

loans.name: Mahmadsafar

texts.ru:
Махмадсафар живет со своей семьей в городе Дангара. Дангара такой город, что если вы приедете туда, каждый житель будет вам рад и каждый из них будет признателен, если вы окажитесь гостем в их доме. Жители Дангары и всех других городов и областей Таджикистана настолько дружелюбны и гостеприимны, что не одна страна не может сравниться с ними. Дружелюбию и вежливостью Махмадсафар не уступает своим землякам. Махмадсафар в Дангаре живет очень давно и нашел жену оттуда же. Теперь он отец шестерых детей. Ему 40 лет. Он 18 лет работает водителем, у него среднетехническое образование. Также Махмадсафар со своей женой работают колхозниками на земельном участке Рахмончона. Параллельно он занимается животноводством, дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. 
Махмадсафар берет кредит для увеличения поголовья крупных скотов, так как дома у него только один теленок.
texts.en:
Mahmadsafar lives with his family in the town of Dangara. Dangara is the type of town where, if you go there, every resident would be happy to see you and every one of them would be grateful to have you as a guest in their house. The residents of Dangara, as well as all of the other cities and districts of Tajikistan, are such friendly and hospitable people that no other country can compare. Mahmadsafar is just as friendly and courteous as his fellow countrymen. 

Mahmadsafar has lived in Dangara for a very long time and even found his wife there. Now he is a father of six children. He is 40 years old. He has worked for 18 years as a driver. He has a secondary technical education. He and his wife work as collective farm workers on Rahmonjon's parcel of land. Simultaneously, he practices animal husbandry. He raises cattle at his home. Mahmadsafar is taking out a loan to increase the size of his herd, as he only as has one calf at his home.

loans.use: to buy a calf to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Mumin

texts.ru:
Каждый мужчина в своей жизни должен сделать 3 вещи: построить дом, посадить дерево и воспитать сына. Так уж получилось, что Мумин сначала женился и привел свою жену в родительский дом. И родились у них трое детей. И дерево он успел посадить. И сына воспитал прекрасно. Теперь его сын работает в России и доволен своей работой. Сам Мумин в течение многих лет работает водителем КАМАЗа. Сейчас ему 68 лет он хочет дополнительно заняться животноводством. Так как жизнь с каждым днем еще труднее. Он хочет сумму от кредита потратить на закупку крупнорогатых скотов. За счет полученной прибыли в будущем Мумин планирует построить дом. В доме, на котором они живут, достался им от родителей. Несмотря на свой возраст, он не хочет остаться в долгу перед сыном. 
Мумин заранее благодарит Всех за помощь.
texts.en: Every man has to do 3 things in his life: build a house, cut down a tree, and raise a son. So first Mumin got married and brought his wife to the house he grew up in. THey had three children. And he did cut down a tree. And he raised his son successfully.  Now his son works in Russian and is happy with his job. Mumin himself has been working many years as a driver for the truck manufacturer KamAZ. Now he is 68 and wants to also get involved in animal husbandry. Life gets more difficult for him by the day. He wants to obtain a loan to pay for the purchase of cattle. Mumin plans on using the income obtained with the loan to build a house. The house he lives in was left to him by his parents. Despite his age, he does not want to owe his son money. Mumin thanks everyone in advance for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 33 years old and has three children. Nena is married and her three children are in school.

Nena is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her vegetables.

Nena has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her vegetables.

loans.name: Khtouy

texts.en:
Khtouy is 33 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. Her husband is a farmer. She also farms and fishes to earn money to nourish and educate her children. Khtouy still needs the support from her husband, who collaborates with her in pursuing these businesses. 

Khtouy is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fishing supplies such as a boat, traps, and nets. Having enough materials for her business will enable them to continue their fishing business. With the income she expects to generate from the business, she will save for the future education of her children and for starting a retail business from her home. Through their effort and hardships, they will build strong businesses and ensure a better standard of living for their children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing supplies such as a boat, traps, and nets.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Mr. Usman is 29 years old, and is a married man. He lives with his family in Punjab, Pakistan. Since 2001, he has been running a shoe shop, which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases a variety of shoes, and sells them in the market. He is offering all types of shoes and for all age groups. He has ladies, gents and children's varieties. 

Currently, he needs to purchase a new variety of shoes for children. However due to financial constrains, he finds it difficult. Because of this his customers are decreasing day-by-day. So he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of loan amount he will purchase a variety of children's shoes to sell.

This will not only help him to grow his business, but will increase his net income and savings as well. He wants to provide a quality education for his children. He is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of children's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Even though Ekua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. 

Currently, Ekua is an trader. Her business has grown substantially since she began 25 years ago. She sells smoked fish in Nakwa (near Cape Coast). 

Ekua is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Ekua sees a growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more smoked fish to sell. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to have a good education to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is married and has three children.  Her husband is a fisherman.  Due to difficult circumstances, she did not have access to a formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Adwoa prepares and sells doughnuts in Nakwa (near Cape Coast), which she has been doing for one year.  

Adwoa is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase flour to prepare more doughnuts, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She uses all her income to feed and provide for her entire family.  Adwoa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Even though Efua had no access to formal education, she decided to set up her own provisions shop business in Nakwa (near Cape Coast). With over 10 years' worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. 

Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more provisions for resale. 

She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a fisherman) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their six children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama prepares and sells "kenkey" (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) and porridge in Nakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about a year. 

As a single mother with four children, Ama uses all her income to provide for her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall porridge sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall porridge sales.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a small-scale "gari" seller. Gari is a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava and rice. She primarily sells her gari in Nakwa (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Joyce has been preparing and selling gari for close to two years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of cassava, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of mounting a gari stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of cassava, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Sophiah

texts.en:
Sophiah is 33 years old and sells clothes in the town of Tala. She is married and has been in this business for 1 year. It has been profitable.

This being her first loan term, she plans to buy more clothes for resale. These include blouses, shawls, and dresses. She will use the anticipated profits to open a shop in the area. 

In future, Sophiah hopes to grow her clothes selling business and open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ziyoboy

texts.ru: Зиёбой трудолюбивый и воспитанный мужчина. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. В своё время он смог обучиться в средней школе и даже в Университете и получил высшее образование. Но всё-таки, даже имея высшее образование Зиёбой не смог найти себе достойную работу в своём посёлке. В связи с чем он был вынужден устроиться на работу на местный рынок сторожем. В тот момент он не думал о престиже, ему нужно было кормить своих детей. Жена Зиёбоя также работает, чтобы помогать своему мужу приносить в дом доход. Она работает поваром в местной столовой. Они получают не такой большой доход, но их поддерживают также сыновья. Два сына Зиёбоя находятся на заработках в России,ежемесячно они присылают своим родителям хороший доход. Сам Зиёбой уже на протяжении нескольких лет сотрудничает с Арванд, он неоднократно получал кредит на удовлетворение своих нужд, и своевременно выплачивал все свои обязательства по кредиту. Сейчас Зиёбой хочет женить своего сына, поэтому ему необходимы денежные средства для организации свадебного мероприятия. Поэтому Зиёбой обратился в Арванд и на этот раз и хочет получить кредит для проведения свадьбы своего сына. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Ziyoboy is a hard-working and well-raised man. He is married and has four children. In his time, he was able to get a secondary education and even received a university education. Nevertheless, even with a college degree, Ziyoboy was unable to find decent work in his village. By virtue of this, he was forced to take a job as a guard at the local market. At that moment, he did not think about prestige, as he had to feed his children. Ziyoboy's wife also works to help her husband bring earnings home. She works as a cook at a local café. They do not earn a lot of money, but their sons also support them. Two of Ziyoboy's sons are working in Russia and they send their parents a good amount of earnings monthly. 

Ziyoboy himself has worked with Microfinance Company Arvand over a period of several years. He has received loans several times to cover his needs and has paid back all of his loan obligations on time. Now Ziyoboy wants to marry off his son, which is why he requires the necessary funds for organizing the wedding ceremony. For this reason, Ziyoboy turned to Microfinance Company Arvand, this time to receive a loan to pay for his son's wedding. He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to organize a wedding ceremony for his son.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо много лет работала на рынке. Она продавала ткани, потому что у нее в семье были финансовые трудности. У Дилрабо нет высшего образования. Она не могла его получить, из-за нехватки финансов и времени. Чтобы получить образование начала работать. Сейчас ей 32 года, она студентка 2-го курса педагогического института. Дилрабо очень хочет учиться, и учится на отлично. Ее обучение платное. Дилрабо просит кредит, чтобы оплатит за один год обучения. Уже в течение нескольких месяцев она работает учительницей младших классов. Дилрабо учит и теорию и практику на деле. Ей нравиться, то чем она занимается. И старается, чтоб из-за финансовых проблем, не рушились ее мечты. Она благодарит Вас за поддержку.
texts.en:
For many years, Dilrabo worked in the market. She sold fabrics, because her family had many financial difficulties. Dilrabo does not have a higher education. She was not able to get one because of lack of funds and time. In order to get an education, she started to work. 

Now, she is 32 years old. She is a student in the 2nd year of the pedagogical institute. Dilrabo really wants to learn and to learn with excellence. Her education is not free. Dilrabo is requesting a loan in order to pay one year's tuition. 

For several months, she has been working as an elementary school teacher. Dilrabo teaches both theory and practice. She likes what she is doing. And she keeps trying that because of her financial problems her dreams will not crumble. She is thankful for the support.

loans.use: to pay tuition at the institute

loans.name: Comision Vecinal Del Barrio Azucena Group

texts.es:
La Comisión Vecinal del Barrio Azucena fue creada el 13 de Febrero del  año 2004 y desde la fecha hasta hoy en día provee agua potable a todos los vecinos del barrio Azucena. Actualmente  cuenta con un pozo y un tanque propio, que permite la distribución de agua a 370 familias, alrededor de 1480 personas de esa forma tienen acceso a algo tan imprescindible para todo ser humano.
Solicitan el crédito para la compra de medidores en su primera etapa, con lo cual desean concienciar a los usuarios el uso prudente del agua y  seguir haciendo llegar a todas las personas con la mejor calidad este servicio tan importante.
Esta aguatería está ayudando a toda su comunidad y es por eso que piden este crédito para poder ofrecer mejor servicio e ir creciendo y que más personas tengan acceso al vital líquido. Aparecen en la foto del grupo Desiderio, quien es el presidente de la aguatería, Leonor quien es tesorero y Christian que es el pro tesorero.
texts.en: This neighbourhood commission in Coronel Oviedo's Azucena district was formed on February 13, 2004, since when it has been supplying drinking water to the residents of the Azucena district.  They currently have their own well and water tank, which enables them to supply water to 370 families, meaning that approximately 1,480 people have access to this commodity which is so vital to mankind.  They are applying for the loan, in the first instance, to buy water meters so they can make users aware of the need to use water carefully and to continue offering this vital service with the same high quality.  This water supply business is benefitting the whole community and so they are seeking the loan so they can offer a better service, continue to develop the business and make this vital liquid available to more people.  In the group photo, we see Desiderio (the president of the water supply business), Leonor (the treasurer) and Cristian (the vice-treasurer).

loans.use: to buy water meters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new fishing net to replace the old one.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 43-year-old divorced woman who has been working selling clothes, cosmetics, and home decoration needs since 2005 from her house to make her own living. Souad is well known in  her region. With her courage and hard work, she started her own business to improve her living and to make sure that she'll stay capable of covering her needs and paying her necessary living expenses.

Today Souad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new autumn and winter clothes collection. Souad will also buy new cosmetics and home decorating items that will attract customers' attention and increase her income.

This is Souad's eighth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with good standing and a good paying-back history. Through her previous cycles, she has been able to  diversify her products. She hopes that one day she can open her separate business outside her house and expect new customers.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a new autumn and winter collection

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат 24 года работает учительницей в школе в городе Исфара. Целый день она проводит в школе. По вечерам она идет помогать мужу и сыновьям по работе. У них семейный бизнес по приготовлению и продажи шашлыка и национальных пирожков из мяса - самбуса. Их маленькая семейная столовая существует уже 11 лет. Саломату нравиться то чем занимается. Потому что с ней ее любимый муж и дети. У Саломата и ее мужа трое сыновей. Средний из них работает в Российской Федерации. Он никогда не забывает своих родных и постоянно с ними на связи. Цель их кредита, это продолжение бизнеса и покупки новых оборудований для их столовой. Саломат с семьей планируют привести более качественные продукты из города и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en: Salomat has been a school teacher in Isfara for 24 years. She spends her entire day at the school. In the evenings, she helps her husband and sons. They have a family business selling meat kabobs and sambusa — a Tajik meat pasty. They've had a small stall  for 11 years. Salomat likes her work, largely because she gets to be with her husband and children. She and her husband have three sons. Their middle son works abroad in Russia. He never forgets his parents and always stays in touch with them. The purpose of their loan is to maintain their business and purchase new cooking equipment for their stall. Salomat and her family plan on bringing in more high quality food items from the city and drawing new customers.

loans.use: to purchase new cooking equipment for their food stall.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a lady of 32 years. She is married to Kenneth and a mother of two children. She is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for 14 years now. She gets a monthly income of 33,800 shillings.

This will be Nancy's sixth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy hay and food for her lactating cows. In the future, she wants to buy more cows and also start poultry farming.

loans.use: To purchase hay and food for lactating cows.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie, a 32-year-old married mother of three children, has made a living through her general store by selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, along with her family. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. which was used to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery items for sale. A portion of her generated profit will be saved for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 29-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen.  He has a shop selling basic grocery products in a small public area. He started his business by working in a retail shop; that enabled him to save capital to open his general store. In addition to using his business for selling to customers, he also uses it to help older families so they don't have to go to the market in the city, and he attempts as much as possible to provide his customers' needs himself. 

Now, he would like to expand his business, but the wholesalers hesitate to provide him with the required goods, dealing with him as a lower-class person, which has become a challenge for him. In spite of that, he was able to return his shop back to usual, but he could not buy all the items he had before as he needs financial support. So, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB in order to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, mineral water, etc., for his business. This loan would help to meet the demand of his clientele, bringing in all that they require. In the future, he hopes to expand his business more in order to increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, mineral water, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Асель - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Асель занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Асель, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асель обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Асель планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Asel is 30 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Asel has a university education. As the main source of income for her family, Asel practices animal husbandry. She started this business 10 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Asel's hard work, she currently has one milk cow and one horse on her farm. Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Asel turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Asel plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy bull-calves.

loans.name: Baatarkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Baatarkhuu, 29 years old, lives with his wife, three children and mother-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a sales manager at a private firm since 2010. His wife and mother-in-law make Mongolian traditional clothes on orders from retailers. 

This summer, he began repairing his house, which has deteriorated over the years. He is requesting a loan of 4,800,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass, shingles and cement. After the repair, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass and cement.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Araba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling banku (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish paste). She usually sells her banku in Nakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling banku for 20 years. 

Araba is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Araba wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty banku. In the long term, Araba plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the  rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells banku (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She can be found selling banku in Nakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. 

Ekua is married and has four children. Her husband is fisherman. The proceeds from her banku business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Costa San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formo con 22 mujeres de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ellas hicieron la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas. Gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo estan mejorando sus ingresos y así pueden seguir ayudando a sus familias.
Lida empieza su jornada de trabajo todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, ya que se dedica a la venta de leche y tiene que dar su producto fresco a los clientes para la hora del desayuno. Comenta que el programa de comité le ha sido de mucha ayuda ya que ha podido mejorar mucho.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche para la venta, y asi seguir con sus ventas y dando a sus clientes un buen producto de primera.
texts.en: This group is comprised of 22 women from the town of Coronel Oviedo. They filled a survey on eliminating poverty to know more about their own financial situation. Thanks to their efforts and hard work, they are improving their income, in order to keep helping their families. Lida, a member of the group, begins work very early every day, since she sells milk and needs to sell her fresh product to her customers before breakfast. She tells us that the work done by the group has proved a tremendous help, since she has been able to improve a lot. She asks for this loan in order to buy milk to sell and keep her business alive by providing her customers with a high-quality product.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta. Her previous loan was a big help  as she was able to buy more party supplies for her business. Her income from the loan is helpful in her children's education and in their everyday expenses at home. She has been in this business for seven years now. She also has videoke machines for rent for additional income. 

She would now like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their 'jeepney' (transport vehicle).
