Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta dreams of expanding her business and having other businesses. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en: Fedelina is married with three children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. Fedelina is a farmer and has been raising pigs to earn a living for ten years. She also operates a general store, and she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her store. Fedelina has been a member of PMPC for four years, and in the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to restock her store business

loans.name: Chray

texts.en:
Chray is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been working in the agriculture sector for 14 years. She is specialized in growing rice and raising fish. She spends a lot time taking good care of crops and feeding her fish because she wants to ensure high quality production, and thereby generate a better her income than in prior years. Her husband helps her and works closely with these two businesses. 

She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) from HKL and Kiva. She will use this loan to purchase fertilizers to keep her rice crops in good condition and buy sacks of feed for her fish. She expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable her to reinvest for the expansion of the farming and fishing business. She believes that, through her perseverance, she will alleviate her family out of poverty and give her children a good quality of life someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to keep her rice crops in good condition and buy sacks of feed for her fish.

loans.name: Sai Ram Group

texts.en:
Bissam Cuttack is a small town of the Rayagada district in Odisha, India, where Kumudini, about 48 years old, resides with her husband and four children. They have two daughters, about 26 and 22 years old, and two sons, about 28 and 24. The lady seated at extreme left with raised hand in the photograph is Kumudini. In the year 2011, she formed a JLG with other members of her village to avail loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Kumudini has done tailoring and embroidery work in her house for nine years. She has one tailoring machine. Her younger daughter is helping her in this business. Kumudini and her daughter both know embroidery work. Besides the tailoring work, she makes toys, pillow covers, wall hangings in different designs, TV covers, filter covers, etc. She has a good number of customers. Peoples give orders for wall hangings for their new houses. Kumudini earns about Rs 6,500 in a month. 

Her husband does a private job with a monthly salary. According to Kumudini, this amount is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditure as well as business expenses. So she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income. This will be her second cycle loan. With it she wants to purchase new cloth, threads and one Pico machine. Kumudini has a long desire to have an established cloth store with embroidery at Muniguda and gain name and fame in her locality.

Besides Kumudini there are five other members in the group. Three members - Ayesha, Bharati and Kalyani -- need a loan for a readymade dress shop, a fast food hotel and a tailoring shop, respectively. The other two members - Prabhati and Jhilli -- both need a loan for leaf plate wholesaling.

loans.use: to purchase new cloth, threads and one Pico machine.

loans.name: Selemane

texts.en: Selemane is 66 years old. He sells animals and has been running the business for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more goats for sale. He plans to use the profits for buying a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale.

loans.name: Adeel

texts.en:
Mr. Adeel is a 27-year-old man. He lives with his family in Punjab, Pakistan. Since 2005, Adeel has been running his own general store near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He sells a variety of daily-use products in his store, including milk, ice cream, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, popcorn, chips, etc. 

His monthly net income is inadequate to cope with the family needs and expenses, so he is planning to add more variety of products to sell in his shop. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan amount, he would purchase cooking oil, flour, rice and yogurt to sell. This will not only help him to attract more customers, but will also increase his net income and savings, which would be helpful for him to meet his family needs and expenses more efficiently. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, flour, rice and yogurt to sell.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Шоира живёт в маленьком сельском посёлке. Она мечтает, чтобы её дети выросли хорошими образованными людьми. Для этого Шоира со своим мужем делает всё для них. Ей приходится много работать, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым. Шоира вот уже с 2011 года сотрудничает  с Авранд, и является ответственным клиентом. Она занимается животноводством. Каждый раз,  получив кредит,  она покупает скот и ухаживает, откармливает  и продаёт на местном рынке. Шоира рассказывает, что после того, как она начала сотрудничество  с Арванд, её жизнь изменилась в лучшую сторону и она благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку. Шоира указывает путь и другим женщинам, чтобы они трудились и устраивали свою жизнь в лучшую  сторону. Она является хорошим примером женщины предпринимателя для других женщин. Шоира всегда рада помочь и дать совет. Сейчас Шоира хочет расширить свой бизнес животноводства, путём приобретения нескольких голов скота для дальнейшего вскармливания. Поэтому она вновь обратилась в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Shoira is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She is married and has five children. Together with her family, Shoira lives in a small rural village. She dreams that her children will grow into well-educated people. For this, Shoira and her husband do everything for them. She has to work very hard in order to earn money and to support her children with all the necessities. 

Since 2011, Shoira has been working with Arvand and has shown herself to be a responsible customer. She is involved in raising livestock. Each time she receives a loan, she buys cattle and cares for, fattens and sells them at the local market. Shoira says that after she started working with Arvand her life changed for the better and she is thankful to Arvand for the financial support. 

Shoira is showing the way also to other women in order for them to work and arrange their lives for the better. She is a good example of a woman entrepreneur for other women. Shoira is always glad to help and give advice. 

Now Shoira wants to expand her livestock business through the acquisition of several head of cattle for further fattening. Therefore, she again turned to Arvand in order to get a loan to buy cattle. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
Заррина уроженка города Исфара. Ее муж работает за границей. Она домохозяйка и живет с сыном. Ее сыну 17 лет, он учиться в школе. Заррина несколько лет работала в медицинском колледже учительницей русского языка. Сейчас она сидит дома и шьет и вышивает шторы на заказ. Такому ремеслу Заррину научила ее мать. В их роду все девушки были мастерицами, они должны уметь шить, готовить, стирать и справиться со всеми домашними работами. Она Заррину правильно воспитала. Четыре года назад, когда Заррина больше не работала и сидела дома, она не грустила, потому что знала, чем она будет заниматься. И поверьте, не дня не было, чтоб она пожалела. Она не знала, что шить шторы и придумывая им разные рисунки, орнаменты и аксессуары предоставит ей такое удовольствие. 
Заррина берет кредит для приобретения компьютерной швейной машины. С помощью полученного кредита она сможет поменять свою старенькую машинку на новую компьютерную швейную машинку. Ей не придется все время ее чинить, и она будет шить без технического перерыва.
texts.en:
Zarrina is a native of Isfara city. Her husband works abroad. She is a homemaker and lives with her son. Her son is 17 years old and studies at school. Zarrina worked for several years as a Russian language instructor at a medical college. Now she stays at home and sews and embroiders custom curtains. Zarina's mother taught her this trade. In their family, all of the girls were expert homemakers - they all were expected to know how to sew, cook, clean and manage all of the household tasks. Zarrina's mother raised her well. Four years ago, when Zarrina stopped working and became a homemaker, she was not sad about it because she knew what she would do to support herself. And, believe me, there has not been a day when she has felt sorry for herself. She had no idea that sewing curtains and thinking up different patterns for them would give her such satisfaction. 

Zarrina is requesting a loan to purchase a computerized sewing machine. With the assistance of the received credit, she will be able to replace her old machine for a new, computerized sewing machine. She won't have to repair this machine all the time and she will be able to sew without technical malfunctions.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy  lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where, for 12 years, she has earned a living by running a general store earning 10,000 PHP a month. She has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used in her business. Now, she has borrowed a new  loan of 10,000 PHP  to buy more grocery items for sale. Her future goals are to build a house and save for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for sale

loans.name: Zura

texts.en:
Zura is a 21-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and mother in a small village of the Sachkhere district. 

Zura runs an agricultural business. He has a greenhouse and grows cucumbers and tomatoes to sell at local restaurants. He has run this business for nine years. 

Zura needs to purchase polyethylene for his greenhouse to renovate and also expand. He requested a loan of 1,500 Gel and the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, gave him a chance to get this loan. As the greenhouse is expanded and covered with a new polyethylene, he will be able to grow more tomatoes and cucumbers to sell. This will increase his income and Zura will provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Kholmirzo

texts.ru: Холмирзо трудолюбивый и порядочный мужчина. Он женат и имеет 5 детей. Живёт он со своей семьёй в сельском посёлке. Холмирзо имеет среднее образование, но в свою очередь совсем недавно он был избран председателем местного дехканства. Вот уже с 2010 года Холмирзо тесно ведёт сотрудничество с  Арванд, таким образом, благодаря финансовой поддержке Арванд, он смог начать своё собственное дело, которое приносит сегодня ему постоянный доход. Холмирзо занимается животноводством, а также выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Для этого у него имеется большая площадь земли, где он выращивает свою культуры и пасёт скот.  Жена Холмирзо работает  учительницей в местной школе. Таким образом она помогает мужу приносить в семью доход. Также она помогает мужу в его бизнесе, она ухаживает за скотом, а также продаёт молоко, полученное от имеющегося скота. Сейчас Холмирзо хочет расширить количество своего скота, поэтому он обратился в Арванд и желает получить кредит для покупки несколько голов скота. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Kholmirzo is a hardworking and decent man. He is married and has five children. He lives with his family in a rural village. Kholmirzo has a high school education. In turn, he recently was elected chairman of his local dekhan (group) farms. It has been since 2010 that Kholmirzo has closely cooperated with Arvand. Thanks to the financial support of Arvand, he was able to start his own business, which today brings him a steady income. Kholmirzo is involved in raising livestock and also in agriculture. For this, he has a large plot of land where he grows crops and grazes cattle. Kholmirzo's wife works as a teacher in a local school. She also helps her husband to bring income to the family. She helps her husband in his business; she cares for the cattle and also sells milk received from the existing cattle.

Now Kholmirzo wants to expand the quantity of her livestock and therefore she turned to Arvand. She wishes to receive a loan to buy several head of cattle. She hopes for a positive results and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a business lady who does tailoring in Nairobi town. She is 35 years old, married, and she has three children. She has been in this business for 15 years.

She plans to use the loan to purchase fabrics and textile material for dressmaking and thereafter expand her business as well as pay back the loan with the anticipated profits. This is her first loan, and she hopes to become successful, build a residential house for her family and also grow her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric and textile materials.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 46 years old and does poultry farming in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for five years and it has been profitable. She is single and has three children.

She plans to use the loan to buy more poultry for rearing as well as more stock of poultry feeds. She anticipates more profits that she will use to improve her living standards. This is her first loan term.

Christine hopes to become a large-scale poultry farmer and supplier.

loans.use: To buy poultry and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has a barber shop in Nairobi town. He is 28 years old, married, and has one child, aged 3 years old. His wife also provides income in support of the family. He has been in this business for eight years. 

He will use the loan to buy more haircut equipment and other barber materials. He will also buy compact disks and DVD’S for resale.  He will use the anticipated profits to expand his barber shop and soon open another barber shop. This is his second loan, after paying his previous loan successfully. 

He hopes to become a successful businessman and a responsible parent.

loans.use: To buy haircut equipment and compact disks for resale

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife resides at Sebasi, Clarin in Misamis Occidental with her family.  Her husband is a farmer, while she runs a retail business to earn a living. 

Her previous loan was used for her business, and it was successfully repaid. Recently, she needs financial support for their corn production. She has borrowed PHP 12,000 to purchase fertilizer and cover the labor costs of plowing their farm. 

She is hopeful that she gains more profit from their farm and from her business as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover the labor costs of plowing her farm

loans.name: Safdar

texts.en:
Safdar owns a shoe shop in the area of Punjab, Pakistan. He is an active borrower of BRAC, Pakistan. He has a large family, consisting of his wife and seven children. He is the only earning person for his family. His expenses are much higher then his monthly net income. He has to pay for all the utility bills, electricity bills, gas and water bills alone. Beside all these bills, he has to pay for the children's education fee, and he has to meet other family expenditures alone. However, his monthly income is very low to meet all the expenses. 

He is planning to add more variety to his shop so that he can increase his selling and net income. However, due to financial constraints he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a good variety of shoes to sell. By doing so, he can attract more customers and he can increase his net income and savings as well. 

Safdar is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра очень позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Дети у неё взрослые и учатся в школе. Сайёра живёт со своей семьёй в маленьком сельском посёлке. Живут они в доме, который достался ей от её родителей. Этот дом был построен совсем давно и на сегодня его состояние достаточно ухудшилось. Всё это время Сайёра с мужем пытались как-то делать мелкий ремонт в своём доме, но этого хватало не надолго. И уже давно она хочет построить для своей семьи достойный большой и благоустроенный дом. Но до сих пор они не могли накопить необходимую сумму денег для этого. Сама Сайёра вместе со своим мужем занимаются животноводством, этот бизнес приносит им постоянный доход, но этих денег хватает только на проживание. А на расходы по строению дома необходима большая сумма денежных средств. Поэтому Сайёра со своим мужем приняли решение и обратились в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Сайёра хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для строительства своего дома. Она верит и надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Sayora is a very positive and hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. Her children are adults and are studying in school. Sayora lives with her family in a small village. The live in a house that she got from her parents. This house was built quite a long time ago and today its conditions have deteriorated quite a bit. All this time, Sayora and her husband have tried somehow to make small repairs to their home, but this did not last for long. And she has long wanted to build her family a sufficiently large and comfortable home. But they have not been able to save the necessary money for this.  

Sayora and her husband are engaged in raising livestock. This business brings them a steady income, but the money is not enough to live. And for the building expenses, they need a large amount of money. Therefore, Sayora and her husband made a decision and turned to Arvand for financial support. Sayora wants to receive a loan to buy construction materials for building her home. 

She believes and hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a businesswoman running her general store. She is married and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. 

The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. She keeps on running the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative's (PMPC) support, as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Elizabeth has reached her seventh year as a member of PMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 for inventory for the store. 

Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. Elizabeth has confidence that she can maintain the label of 'member in good-standing'. She is a hard-working mother and she wishes to sustain the store and, from there, provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to restock her general store.

loans.name: Niholbi

texts.ru:
Как гласит народная мудрость муж голова женщина его шея. И к этому лишнее доказательство пара Нихолби и ее мужа. Муж Нихолби создает гравировки на стенках национальной колыбельки. Она придает цвет и насыщенность к его рисункам. Колыбельки они создают вместе. 
  Нихолби была с мужем, когда он только начинал создавать свои рисунки и посей день она рядом. Помогает, поддерживает и любит. Нихолби хочет взять кредит для закупа краски и лака.
texts.en:
As the proverb says, a man is a head and his wife is his neck. And Niholbi and her husband are living proof of this. Niholbi's husband creates engravings on the walls of national cribs. She gives color and richness to his drawings. They create cribs together. 

Niholbi was with her husband when he was just starting to create his own drawings and she passed the day by his side. She helps him, supports him, and loves him. Niholbi wants to take a loan to buy paint and varnish.

loans.use: to buy paint and varnish

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Paulina is a 40-year-old single mother who has four children. She has a green grocery business in Nairobi and has been running this business for 20 years. 

She currently makes 4,000 Kenya shillings as her monthly income and will use the loan to purchase more vegetables for selling. This is her first loan, and she will use her anticipated profits to add more vegetables and expand her shop. 

Paulina's hopes and dreams are to educate her children and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 54 years old. She is married with nine children aged between 16 and 40. The oldest have already established their homes, and the four youngest attend school. 

Margarita wants the loan to buy more beans and sorghum for resale. The profits from the business are expected to be used to reinvest in the same business for better future returns.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale

loans.name: Jalakanya Group

texts.en:
Lily is a married woman of 24 years and lives with her husband and two daughters and one son aged about 5, 3 and 1 respectively, at Bissam Cuttack under Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing at the extreme left with raised hand is Lily.  She is very energetic, hard-working and always devotes her time for the betterment of her family. 
 
Lily makes leaf plates and sells them in the local market. She has been doing this business for the last six years.  Lily’s husband is a 4th class employee (Home guard). Their family income is only Rs.3,500 per month, so it is very difficult to manage their day-to-day life. Soon after her marriage, Lily started leaf plate making and sold the plates. Initially she was selling them from her home. People were coming and purchasing, but when she started to supply leaf plates and cups to the grocery shops and wedding parties, her business expanded and she able to earn more income. She has already accessed two loans from Mahashakti. This time she needs a loan to purchase leaves from the wholesale market for expanding her business.

She has an ambition of having a 'pacca' (beautiful) house of her own.

The other members of her group, Archana, Ambadi and Laxmi, also want a loan for their leaf plate businesses.

loans.use: to purchase leaves to make leaf plates for sale

loans.name: Maa Manikeswari Group

texts.en:
Mamata, aged about 30 years, resides with her husband and two sons aged about 8 and 5 years at Kutragada,  Rayagada district in Odisha, India. The lady standing at the extreme left with raised hand in the photograph is Mamata. In the year 2009 she formed a JLG with three other members of her village to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation.

For the last 11 years, Mamata has been running a grocery shop. Her husband is a small farmer but also help her with running the business. Mamata’s household income per month is about Rs.6,000 (INR). According to Mamata, this amount is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenditures, so she wants to expand her business to earn some extra income.

She has already accessed three loans from Mahashakti. This is her fourth cycle loan. From the present loan, she wants to purchase rice, sugar, soap, oil, washing powder, potatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, dried chilly, and spice powders, etc. for her grocery shop. Mamata has an ambition to educate her sons for a bright career.

The other three members of the group, Bhagabati, Kabita & Joshna, need a loan for a grocery shop, a leaf plate business and a cycle shop respectively.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, soap, oil, washing powder, potatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, dried chilly, and spice powders, etc

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is aged 37. She is a mother of one child, aged 18 and enrolled in school. With the loan, Marie would like to buy more clothes for sale. She has spent fifteen years in this business. She plans to make more savings from the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with four children, three of whom go to school and one who is underage. She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past two years.  She cites transportation costs as her major business challenge.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a woman of  51 years, the mother of one child.  She sells cereals in the Nairobi business center.  She has been in this business for five years now, and she gets monthly income of KES 19,000.

This will be Caroline's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy more cereals like rice, beans, and green grams, etc. 

In future she wants to improve her family's living standards and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase cereals such as rice, beans ,and green grams.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Señor Ernesto se dedica a la construcción, y a la limpieza y cuidado de patios y jardines, en toda la zona urbana y rural de San Ignacio, vive con su esposa e hijos y todos juntos luchan por salir adelante.
Ernesto comenta que su intención es ir aumentando su cantidad de clientes y encontrar una estabilidad e ingreso constante con sus trabajos realizados y clientes fijos, su deseo es satisfacer a sus clientes para que estos a su vez sean fieles y le pidan sus servicios.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir trabajando, como ser abonos, semillas y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ernesto makes a living in construction and cleaning and taking care of patios and gardens in the entire rural and urban area of San Ignacio.  He lives with his wife and children, and together they strive to get ahead.

Ernesto says his goal is to keep on increasing his clientele and find stability, a constant income with his work, and steady customers.  He wants to satisfy his customers so they'll be loyal and request his services.

Ernesto's requesting this loan to invest in buying soil amendments, seeds, and other supplies to continue working.  He's grateful for this opportunity, which will be a big help to him.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, seeds, and other supplies

loans.name: Said

texts.ru:
Каждый человек в душе художник, каждый из нас в чем-то хорош, в чем-то его талант. Но не каждый может найти себя в глубине души и воплотить в реальность. Саид сумел найти свое призвание в жизни, когда ему было 26 лет. И отнеся к этому серьезно. Он стал гравировщиком. Начальные работы были банальными и простыми, но в них вложена душа. Сейчас его гравировки не с чем не спутать, они выполнены с изяществом и неповторимостью. Он может сидеть за работой целыми часами. Саид совместил приятное с полезным. Он гравирует стенки национальной колыбельки, в народе называют их люльками. Его сын создает люльки, он гравирует, а его жена красит и придает им цвет. Это семейное увлечение и семейный бизнес. 
Саид берет кредит для покупки древесины, краски и лака. Саид надеется, этой суммы ему хватит, и он будет свои идеи воплощать в новые колыбельки.
texts.en:
Every person is an artist in his soul. Each one of us is good at something, has some sort of talent. But not everyone can find this within themselves and materialize it into a reality. 

Said was able to find his calling in life when he was 26 years old and he took it very seriously.  He became an engraver. His initial works were unoriginal and simple, but he put his heart into them. Now his engravings are unmistakable, as they are full of refinement and individuality. He can work on them for hours on end. Said has combined business with pleasure. He engraves the sides of traditional baby bassinets, which are called "lyulkas" in Tajikistan. His son constructs the lyulkas, he engraves them, and his wife paints them and gives them color. It is a family pastime and a family business. 

Said is requesting a loan to buy wood, paint and varnish. Said hopes that this amount will be enough and that he will be able to materialize his ideas on new bassinets.

loans.use: To buy wood, paint and varnish.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
La Sra. Cynthia, está casada con el Sr. Juan quien trabajo como herrero, tienen una hija que está en el nivel primario, viven en casa propia.
Cynthia es dueña de una Ferretería desde hace 7 años, le resulta el negocio ya que tiene clientela formada en la zona y se siente satisfecha con la actividad que hace, pues le genera buen ingreso. Solicita el crédito para compra de artículos varios, como ser cámaras para bicicletas para moto, cubiertas, ejes y otros repuestos para aumentar el stock de sus productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de ir mejorando su negocio y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cynthia is married to Juan, who works as a blacksmith. They have a daughter in primary school and live in a house of their own.

Cynthia has had a hardware store for seven years. She has a good business, since she has local customers. She feels satisfied with this activity and the income it generates. She is requesting a loan to buy different spare parts, such as inner tubes for bicycles and motorcycles, tires and shafts in order to stock her store and fulfill her customers’ requirements.

Cynthia appreciates this opportunity to improve her business and her income.

loans.use: to buy inner tubes, tires and shafts, among other spare parts.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna has been in her motorcycle transportation service based business for three years to earn a living. She resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, with her family.  She purchased spare parts and accessories in her previous loan and it was successfully repaid. She borrowed a new loan recently to buy motorcycle tires. Lorna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle tires.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their 'tricycle'. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta dreams that she will have another tricycle and hopes to have a better living. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their 'tricycle'.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is a 59-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law in a small village of Lagodekhi district, eastern Georgia. Teimuraz runs an agricultural business. He owns three hectares of agricultural land, where he grows maize, eggplants and cabbages. He always has high quality produce, which is sold to local retailers.

 Teimuraz has been involved in this business for nine years. He decided to purchase a tractor and get an additional source of income. Teimuraz requested a loan and the Start Up program which is joint initiative with Kiva and MFO Credo gave him a chance to get a loan of $ 3000 for purchasing a tractor. He will use the tractor for cultivating his land, as well as to renting it out to local people to get additional income. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Vie

texts.en:
Vie runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits,and accepts bill payments. Vie lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Vie is married and has children.

Vie began working with Ruma one year ago because she wanted to increase her income and expand her business by selling mobile airtime and serving bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $ 40 - 45 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, she took a loan from KIVA to get a printer to support her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payment (household electricity payment).

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
Silvina es una persona muy trabajadora, que con esfuerzo esta saliendo adelante, es un ejemplo de lucha y de sacrificio. En su copetín comedor trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Comenta que su crédito anterior de Kiva lo utilizo en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, hoy solicita nuevamente de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de una congeladora para su negocio y así seguir equipándose.
Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Silvina's a very hardworking person who, with effort, is getting ahead.  She's an example of striving and sacrificing.

Silvina works in her snack bar every day from very early in the morning.  She says she used her previous Kiva loan to buy ingredients for her dishes.  She's requesting another loan to be able to invest in buying a freezer and continue supplying her business.

She's grateful for this new opportunity, which will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
This is Eva. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She used her loan in buying supplies and merchandise products. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. She has been in this business for ten years now. Her income from the loan assisted in their everyday expenses at home. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eva dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a good future for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married lady, age 44 years, and supports a family of three members. Her spouse is a teacher and they are blessed with two children, ages 15 and 13 years. Christine rears poultry in their farm and has been in operation for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 15,000 monthly.

She is servicing her fourth loan of KES 36,000 from KADET LTD, and wishes to use this amount to pay school fees for her children who are in secondary school. The profits she earns from her poultry farm will be used to service the loan.

Her dream is to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has four children and has been doing her work for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling eggs.' Her biggest challenge is 'Feeding the chickens especially if they are not laying; it's expensive.' An animals on the farm has been given the name of 'Munik.'

Jane was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'They have a low interest rate.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It's easy to grow with group loans.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family', Jane replied 'Will improve our living standard.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jane owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'TV, DVD' but does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with six children, all in school.  She has operated a kerosene-selling business for the past two years. She cites transportation costs as her major business challenge.

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Vayisi

texts.en: Vayisi is 49 years old. She sells different items in the boutique. She would like to buy more cooking oil and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Romi

texts.en:
Romi runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Romi lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Romi is single.

Romi began working with Ruma four months ago because he wants to increase his income and expand his business by selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $ 35 - 40 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis sigue con sus ventas de Frutas y verduras, es una persona que esta luchando y trabajando duro por salir adelante. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva, y comenta que el anterior lo uso para poder comprar frutas y verduras para la venta y así poder trabajar.
Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibió, pues le fue de mucha ayuda. Hoy pide de nuevo un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de variadas frutas y verduras, para que así siga con sus ventas y procurar el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis continues to sell fruits and vegetables and she is one who works hard to get ahead.  This will be her second Kiva loan and she says that she used the previous one to buy fruits and vegetables so she could work.

She is very grateful for the opportunity because it was very helpful and is asking for a new loan so that she can buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue her sales and support her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Margen

texts.en:
Margen is married, has four children, and resides in Liposong, Ozamiz City. Her husband is a farmer and she help him in their farm to make a living. 

She used her previous loan to buy fertilizer for coconut and banana farm. Now, she requests a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer for her corn production. With the help of GDMPC, her harvest becomes good and the entire farm is greener than before. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers or her corn production.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has three children and has been doing farming work for 20 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is 'selling milk.' His biggest challenge is 'marketing the milk.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Muiru a cow.'

Charles was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'They are efficient in processing their loans.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It's easy to get a loan through group guarantee.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Charles replied, 'Will be able to educate children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Charles owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shugufta's Group

texts.en:
Shugufta is a 45-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband and son. her son is a student. Her husband's income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Shugufta is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Shugufta is a member of 2-person's lending group. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. 

She hopes, with the help of the loan, to increase the net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

Note: In the picture Shagufta raises her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a second-time borrower of the Institution, applying for 1,500,000 UGX. She is a single mother who has managed to look after her two children with the help of a sister. She sells foodstuffs and charcoal to the people staying in her neighbourhood as her business. This business has helped her a lot and it is from it that she managed to buy land and put up a simple house on it. 

When she gave birth to the baby she now has, her business destabilized and she now has only a little capital since she could no longer go to the villages to purchase charcoal to stock, yet she was pulling out money from her working capital. Because of this problem, she is opting to borrow UGX.1,500,000 to restock her business and be able to meet her customers’ demand as before.

She has hopes of servicing the loan well so that she will be able to apply for more money as soon as she finishes repaying this loan.

loans.use: To buy stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Al-Rahma Group

texts.en:
Al-Rahma Group has four members, all of whom work in small businesses where they live in Aden, Yemen. The women feel very excited by the mutual support among them, which is constant and, above all, inspires them with the will to continue striving for their families. Their work as a team, and utilizing all their available resources, makes their efforts their greatest strength. 

Haifa is a street vendor and, through her selfless work, she is raising her family. She has been selling perfumes and ladies' clothes. She defines herself as a very hard-working person who does not fear challenges and dares to do anything to help her family. 

Haifa is applying for a loan of YER 60,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy items, including perfumes and ladies' clothes to resell and, thus, continue improving her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy items, including perfumes and ladies' clothes for resale.

loans.name: Safarmahmad

texts.ru: Сафармахмад муж и отец шестерых детей. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Хуросон. У Сафармахмада кукурузное поле. Более 13 лет он сам заниматься посевом кукурузы. В сборе урожая ему помогают его дочери, потому что сыновья находятся на заработках за рубежом. У Сафармахмада среднетехническое образование, он шофер. Собранный урожай он вывозит из района сам. Сафармахмад надеется, что полученный кредит поможет ему по быстрее собрать урожай и в дальнейшем расширить свое поле. От дохода урожая Сафармахмад со своими земляками займется строительством дороги и снабжать район электричеством. В Таджикистане многие районы и села страдают от отсутствия электричество зимой. К приходу зимы жители района Хуросон готовятся и надеются, что к приходу зимы они закончат свои работы и у них зимой будет электричество.
texts.en:
Safarmahmad is married and is a father to six children.  Together with his family, he lives in Khuroson.  Safarmahmad has a corn field.  For more than 13 years, he has been growing corn.  Because his sons are working abroad, Safarmahmad has his daughters to help him with the harvest.  Safarmahmad is a trained driver and he transports the collected corn to other regions himself.  

Safarmahmad is hoping that this loan will help him collect the harvest faster, and in the future, help him to expand his field.  Safarmahmad and his neighbors are planning to use the profits from the sale of the harvest to build local roads and to provide electricity to their region.  In Tajikistan, many areas suffer in the winter from the lack of electricity.  The local residents are hoping that when the winter comes, the work will be completed and they will have electric power.

loans.use: To rent equipment for harvesting and expansion of his corn field

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has three children, and has been doing this work for 30 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Watering crops.' Her biggest challenge is 'marketing farm produce.' 
Animals on the farm have been given no names. Marta was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Good loan term.'  
This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Low credit cost to enable all to afford.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Marta replied 'Will be able to improve her farming.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Marta owns the following: cow, and poultry, but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower does not have mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase an irrigation kit.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La Señora Alejandra es una persona muy honesta y responsable, vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería que tiene desde hace 6 años.
Doña Alejandra tiene su negocio ubicado en la entrada principal a su comunidad la cual es muy visitada y conocida por los vecinos de la misma, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, manteca, huevos, queso, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, mantequilla, carne, jugos, etc. producto que necesita para surtir más su negocio. 
Doña Alejandra espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias este contara con los insumos necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así mismo satisfacer las necesidades de estos y así espera que sus ventas tengan un aumento considerable y gracias a este ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida y el su familia en el hogar.
Doña Alejandra espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que cumplan sus metas y sueños así como el de que terminen los estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto 2013
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandra is an honest and responsible person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her husband and their three children. She runs a corner store, a business she has had for six years. It is located at the main entrance to the community so it is very busy and well known to local people.

Alejandra is seeking a loan to buy corn, lard, eggs, cheese, soft drinks, doughnuts, rice, beans, bread, coffee, butter, meat, juices etc. so that she can have more stock in her store.

She expects the loan will help her greatly as she will be able to have the items that her customers ask for and thus satisfy their needs. She hopes that sales will increase considerably and she will earn more money and improve her own and her family's standard of living.

Alejandra hopes to expand her business and continue helping her children to achieve their goals and dreams such as completing their education and becoming decent people with better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: buy stock for her corner store

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Maria es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida. Tambien es dueña de una pulperia. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito por el apoyo que le han brindado a través del financiamiento, ya que pudo invertir en productos, la cual comercializa. Este nuevo crédito lo solicita para comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, verduras, platos y vasos con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para aumentar sus ventas e ingresos y  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a native of the town of Managua. She runs a business making and selling food. She is also the owner of a grocery store. Maria is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito for the financial support they have brought her as she was able to buy more products and then sell them.

This new loan will be used to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, bananas and glasses so she can satisfy the needs of her customers. She expects the loan will provide a lot of help in increasing sales and profits, and improving her standard of living.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, bananas, and glasses

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à KABOILA un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs trente troisième prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.  
Mme AFOU première à droite fait le commerce  d’ustensiles en plastique (tasses, assiettes, des gobelets, des bols, etc.)
Elle compte investir tout le montant de son prêt dans ces matériels en plastique qu’elle revendra en détail au marché à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 500 francs CFA dont une partie est utilisée pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kotognogontala group are married women who on average are 40 years old with five children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Kaboila, one of the populous neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their 33rd loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to meet their customers' needs.

Ms. Afou on the far right is a merchant of plastic utensils (cups, plates, goblets, bowls, etc.). She intends to use the whole of her loan in buying the plasticware she will then resell for cash at a fixed location in the market, assisted by family members, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 32,500 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the remainder put into savings.

loans.use: buy plastic wares

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 58, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Avelino, a driver, and she is a mother to their children. She and husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Erlinda operates a rug-making business. She sells rugs, from round palm-sized ones to the much larger doormats, and other crafts. Rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning and one of the most common products that can be bought. They are sold even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help Erlinda continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Erlinda dreams that her business will get bigger and hopes that her family remains in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Den

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, four of whom are in school, Den works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Den is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Den has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 46 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have four children who all go to schools. Simon will use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming Simon wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer and labor cost

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama est âgé de 31 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il vit dans une famille polygame à Bougouni, au quartier Dialanicoro. Après quelles années d’étude à l’école coranique mais sans succès, il décide de s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et la vente des condiments. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un de ses ami. Avec une expérience de plus 10 ans, il maîtrise cette activité dans laquelle est très sollicité et apprécié. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et avec qui il est à son cinquième prêt, tous les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter, 2 cartons de concentrée de tomate,100kg d’oignons,10 paquets de cube maggi et 1 sac de sel.Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (Capitale de la République du Mali). La vente de ses condiments se fait à Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composé essentiellement de femmes. La rotation de son activité est très élevée et il espère  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il compte payer les intérêts du prêt, assurer certaines dépenses de la famille et améliorer d’avantage son entreprise.
texts.en: Mr. Adama is 31 years old, married, and a father of two. He lives in a polygamous family in Bougouni, in the Dialanicoro neighborhood. After several unsuccessful years at the Koranic school, he turned to starting a business to earn a living, notably in the buying and selling of seasonings. He learned about this business from one of his friends. With more than 10 years of experience, he mastered this business, in which he is sought after and popular. In order to satisfy his clientele which continues to grow, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his fifth loan, the previous four having all been properly repaid. With this new loan, he plans to buy 2 boxes of concentrated tomatoes, 100 kg of onions, 10 packets of Maggi cubes, and 1 sack of salt. He stocks up at Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). He sells his seasonings in Bougouni. His clientele is composed mostly of women. The rotation of his business is very high, and he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA. With this profit, he plans to pay interest on his loan, pay for certain family expenses, and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
This is Angelyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, as she was able to buy more gallons of diesel fuel to sell. Her income from this business is helping her pay for her family's everyday expenses at home. Her business is still running, and she has also opened a food stall for additional income. 

She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed for her food stall. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Angelyn hopes that her newly opened business will be successful and dreams that her child will finish his studies. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: Amidou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1980 à Diendio, un des villages de la commune rurale de Kadiana (troisième région administrative de la république), Amidou réside dans son village natale avec ses 3 enfants et sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle.
Mr Amidou s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  bœufs.  Il est très sollicité au marché de Kadiana et surtout les jours de foire. 
Fort de ses 9 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir remboursé le prêt précédent. 
Amidou compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des bœufs. Il s’approvisionne chez les éleveurs dans les villages avoisinants. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché essentiellement à  des hommes.
Amidou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1980 in Diendio, a village in the rural town of Kadiana (a subprefecture in Mali's third administrative region), Amidou continues to reside in Diendio with his wife and three children as a traditional family unit. Amidou quickly became interested in money-making businesses, notably the buying and selling of cattle. He is highly sought-after at the market in Kadiana, especially during festival days. With his nine years of solid experience within this field, he collaborates with Soro Yiriwaso to increase his business funds in order to satisfy his ever-expanding list of customers. This will be his second loan, after having fully paid off the first. 

Amidou plans to use this loan to buy cattle. He supplies cattle farmers in neighboring villages. He accepts payments cash-in-hand, yet sometimes with credit, at the marketplace where the majority of his customers are male. Amidou hopes to see a monthly profit of 150,000 CFA, which will be used to provide for his family, pay back the loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Shida

texts.en:
Shida is married with six children, three attending school and three adults. The family lives in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Shida has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past year. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials for her house.

loans.name: Dalmalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Dalmalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from making nipa roofing.  Dalmalyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  purchase an additional fishing net and materials for the maintenance of her boat for her fishing business.

Dalmalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has three children and has been doing this work for 12 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated that selling eggs is the most enjoyable part of farming. Her biggest challenge is feeding the chickens. 

Grace was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'They offer a grace period.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They offer loans through groups that co-guarantee.'

Her highest monthly expense are school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Grace replied 'More income will educate her children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Grace owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Masha

texts.en:
Masha is a single man who is very hardworking and enterprising. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past three years, he has operated a business selling poultry. He sells to his neighbours and passers-by. His major challenges are high cost of transportation to his place of operation.

With the 10,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Luz De Luna 27 Group

texts.es:
El Banco de emprendimiento LUZ DE LUNA 27,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,   la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Alicia  tiene 44 años, tiene  cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de papas fritas embolsadas, ella ofrece sus productos a distintas tiendas de barrio y colegios  donde ya tiene clientela, 

la Sra. Alicia  va a usar este préstamo para compra de utensilios de cocina como ollas  para así mejorar su producción ,  la  Sra. Alicia  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el tener que levantarse muy temprano para ir a dejar sus productos, ella  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de insumos para seguir mejorando en su negocio y  poder expandirse más y así poder ahorrar, y salir adelante, el deseo de la  Sra. Alicia  es poder abrir su tienda donde pueda ofrecer sus productos, la  Sra. Alicia  es una persona joven con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The LUZ DE LUNA 27 [Light of the Moon 27] communal bank consists of eight members: six women and two men. 

Señora Alicia, the bank president, is 44 years old and the mother of four school-aged children. She works selling bagged potato chips to various neighborhood stores and schools where she's built a customer base. Señora Alicia will use funds from this loan to purchase cooking utensils, such as pots, to increase production. This business presents many challenges, such as getting up very early to deliver products. 

Señora Alicia will use funds from this loan to purchase supplies so she can keep improving her business, expand it, and save more money. Señora Alicia's ambition is to open her own store where she can sell her products. Alicia is young and anxious to get ahead, so she's grateful to lenders for the support they're providing her.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils, such as pots, to achieve greater production

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 26 years old, married, and supports a family of three.  His spouse is a housewife and together they are blessed  with two children aged four and one.  Duncan runs his own hardware shop in Eldama Ravine location. It has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of KES 22,000.

He is now requesting his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. He wishes to purchase additional stock for his hardware shop for resale.  The money he anticipates earning will be used to repay the loan, and he will save any remaining profit for future use.

His dream is to live a better life and also expand his current business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in his hardware shop

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a 27-year-old married man who supports a family of four members. Reuben and his wife are blessed with one child who is 2 years old. He does welding in Eldama Ravine and has been in operation for three years. He earns an average income of 10,000 KES.

With his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD he intends to purchase a new welding machine in order to increase his welding services. The profits  he earns will be used to expand his current business and to purchase metal materials for his business.

His dream is to see his business grow.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Yadira Paola

texts.es:
Yadira es una mujer de 25 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Piura, en el distrito de Jayanca con sus padres, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Yadira no pudo culminar la carrera profesional de Arquitectura que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Yadira trabaja en su pequeño salón de belleza, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Yadira se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará equipos y materiales de trabajo para acondicionar su salón de belleza, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran Spa.
texts.en:
Yadira, 25, is single living wither parents in the city of Piura, Jayanca District.  She’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all her efforts into getting ahead. Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and her need to start working, Yadira was unable to study Architecture like she so wanted to.

On her own initiative, Yadira works in her small beauty salon.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well thanks to her dedication and effort.

Yadira is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will buy equipment and supplies for work to equip the salon.  She will thus continue working and striving to reach her great dream: to own a great spa.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Isla en Guayaquil.  Empezó con esta actividad hace 5 años, después de la separación de su esposo.  Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza y artículos plásticos para cocina.  Labora todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 6 pm en compañía de su hija.  Tiene 2 hijos, una de ellos va a la escuela fiscal y el otro padece de una condición física e intelectual.  A futuro le gustaría tener un negocio de pizzas y pan de yuca; además de luchar por sus  hijos.  Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
María is from the Isla area in Guayaquil.  She started with this business activity five years ago after she separated from her husband. María sells beauty products and plastic kitchen utensils. She works every day with her daughter from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has two children, one of whom goes to the local school and the other suffers from a physical and mental condition.

In the future she would like to have a pizza and yucca bread business, in addition to struggling for her children.  She now needs the loan to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (cosmetics and cooking utensils) for resale

loans.name: Discipline's Group

texts.en:
Discipline's Group is made up of 15 members who live in the same community. They are into slippers, wigs, wax prints, cosmetics, cooking oil, smoked fish and yams. The representative of this group, Lydia (the woman pictured standing fourth from the left), is 25 years old.

To achieve their goal of enhancing the level of their business and to better meet the demands of their customers, this group is, for the first time, requesting financial assistance from ID-Ghana.

Lydia is not married but has a child who attends school. Lydia lives with her child, age six, and Lydia works hard to meet the needs of the household.

For the last seven years, Lydia has sold cosmetics as a supplier in her locality. She stocks up at a market in Ghana. In order to enhance the level of her business and to meet the needs of her customers, Lydia and the other members of Discipline's Group are requesting their first loan of GHS 6,600 from ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. Dolores is married, and she has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Dolores has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.   She has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Kulyumkan

texts.ru: Кулюмкан 57 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Кулюмкан - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулюмкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 37 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулюмкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 кобыла, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулюмкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулюмкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kulyumkan is 57 years old. She is a widow. After her husband’s death she has been raising her children and managing her farm on her own. Kulyumkan has completed a technical college. As a main source of income for her family, Kulyumkan raises livestock, having launched this business 37 years ago by buying livestock for 2,000 KGS. Thanks to Kulyumkan’s hard work, her farm today includes one dairy cow, one  mare, and 10 sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Kulyumkan has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 135,000 KGS in order to expand her livestock by buying cattle. Kulyumkan plans to use the resulting revenues for a further increase of her livestock. She also plans to save up for house renovations.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer como esta cada una en los distintos ámbitos de su vida, donde cada una va mejorando y sabiendo que tiene que trabajar mas, para poder ir mejorando. Una de estas mujeres es Primitiva, quien esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para ir creciendo y mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
Ella tiene una pequeña librería en la que trabaja desde tempranas horas gasta ya entrada la noche, es un ejemplo a seguir por su actitud y lucha. Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cuadernos, libros, lapices y demás, y así seguir dando a sus clientes todo lo que piden y necesitan.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group is part of the "Poverty Stoplight" program which helps members understand various aspects of their lives, how they can be improved, and what they have to do to get there. 

One of the women is Primitiva who is doing the best she can to improve both herself and her life, and that of her family. She runs a small bookstore in which she works from early morning to nightfall. She is a role model to follow because of her positive attitude and efforts. Primitiva is seeking a loan to buy notebooks, books, pencils etc. so she can continue providing her customers with everything they ask for and need.

loans.use: buy notebooks, books, pencils etc.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery tiene 57 años y tiene una hija mayor de 28 años, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida en su pensión que se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Villa Fátima, y tambien esta iniciando con la venta de ropa,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosmery va a usar este préstamo para compra de mercadería Ropa de temporada para nuevo negocio que es el de venta de ropa a pedido su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo,  la Sra. Rosmery enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la edad que tiene, ya necesita más tiempo para cocinar y preparar los platos que por este motivo solo atiende los fines de semana y va a utilizar los beneficios en compra ropa ya que podrá apoyarse en este nuevo negocio que está empezando y también gozara de los beneficios que le dará el nuevo negocio, el deseo de la Sra. Rosmery es llegar a tener un negocio consolidado y así poder mantenerse con el mismo y velar por su hija y nietos.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 57 years old and has a 28-year-old daughter. She earns a living selling food at her home which is situated in the area of Villa Fátima, and she is also starting to sell clothing.
